description:
What a great concept! Having something very, very similar at Turkey, we wanted to give this place and my god it felt like home!

You can choose from tons of different combinations and regardless what you choose it will always be tasty, that I can guarantee. If you are around and if you feel like you need a quick bite to eat, this place won't disappoint you.

All my "Kumpir" fans out there, this is very very close to the real deal.
author: Ali O.

description:
I really, really wanted to like this place. Baked potatoes are my #1 underrated food, and a restaurant dedicated to them sounded excellent! Unfortunately, the reality wasn't as good as the idea.

The restaurant seemed run-down, first of all. The fake wood paneling was super dated, and the table my friend and I sat on wobbled like crazy every time we took a bite. I suppose that fits the touristy vibe of Fisherman's Wharf pretty well, but it's not what I was looking for.

I got a sausage spud because sausage is the best meat and was super underwhelmed. The potato was tasteless (even as potatoes go) and the veggies, while fine on their own, really didn't go with it. The sausage was sort of cold and not very tasty either, and there weren't nearly enough green onions for a potato of this size (though I'm the sort of guy who orders extra extra green onions on his ramen, so take that how you will).

It also seemed mostly if not entirely unseasoned. Baked potatoes need a healthy dose of salt and pepper at the very least, and I expected a potato specialty shop like this to innovate on top of that.

It gets a second star solely for potential. Hot Spud is an excellent idea, but the execution was far, far off-base.
author: Shawn W.

description:
As the quintessence of fast casual on the West Coast, Hot Spud is worth looking into after a long day at Fisherman's Wharf for a quick bite to eat after some sight seeing. Sure it may be a small chain, but the pre-set options combined with the "make it your own" bar make it an excellent alternative from the food traps in the Wharf. 

The restaurant also boats a large cooler of drinks, including wine and beer. I would say a meal costs around $10 without the beverage.
author: Sarah W.

description: Cool place and idea but $$$$. Fresh ingredients and a huge potato. Lots of gluten free options and a clean environment. Friendly staff too. My son loves it.
author: Ben T.

description: This place looks like a dive however it is a great place to get a loaded baked potato! Staff is great and you won't have to wait for long to receive your food!
author: Chris C.

description: Ah-mazing salad tonight.  Fresh crisp veggies, perfect chicken and delicious balsamic dressing!!!Simple, real food at a good price.  Pick one of their salads or potatoes or build your own.  Nice people, clean and quick.  I hope to pop in for a potato tomorrow.  Eat here. (And they had beer)
author: Theresa B.

description:
This was a wonderful local chain in the area to escape the tourism of San Fran. The food was amazing and there was great variety. The wait for the food was a little long, so don't expect a quick stop, but well worth the wait. The prices are great and there is also a Seven Eleven next door if you want to take a break and stock up on snacks or grab a slurpee!
I tried the wharf which came with crab meat, corn, and red and green onion.
Yum! Also - beer is $3.50 for a bottle!
author: Jonna Leanne P.

description:
Great salads and potatoes.  Toppings made it 
unique. Best part it is off the tourist area and not crowded.
author: Malinda P.

description: Satisfying! We were pleasantly surprised as we went in with somewhat low expectations since it's fast food. Restaurant is pretty clean, service is good, and spuds are tasty and filling. Lots of choices with respect to the options and it's a pretty good deal (about $10-11 per spud if you get meat). We just wanted something quick and uncomplicated, and this fit the bill (can't go too wrong with a baked potato).
author: Maria F.

description: After visiting the pier, my friend and I were looking for a spot to eat. This place was not too far of a walk and sounded appetizing as it had been raining all day. I ended up getting the Thai crunch salad which was so filling and delicious. My friend created her own spud and said the same thing. I loved this place for a quick lunch. The workers were  helpful with accommodating my vegan needs, while answering any questions my friend had with suggestions.
author: Leslie R.

description: This place is like Chipotle but for baked potatoes, and as a baked potato lover, it's a dream. I always do a create your own and add the hot wing sauce- SO GOOD. Worth trying out and the portion size is really big. Good lunch spot
author: Rosie L.

description: It's was okay. Service was good but nothing to write home about. Kinda hidden area away from all the tourists but easy to find.
author: Ramiro S.

description:
Popped in here after completing a Big Bus Tour. As I was near Fisherman's Wharf, I determined I HAD to have some crab. I order "The Wharf". I thought the concept was a baked potato with toppings but once the order was taken, they grabbed a spud and started to mix all the base ingredients together. They then repacked the potato then loaded it with my preferred toppings. 

Bonus points the owner let me charge my phone while I ate!
author: Marcy H.

description: Now this place was remarkably awsome.. came here for lunch and I ordered the wharf spud while my friend ordered the shrimp spud.. these big potatoes are jam packed with flavor and mixes together really well.. would def come back here again
author: Brandon V.

description: Great food, good service! Potatoes are GIANT! You can order off the menu or create your own!
author: Amy D.

description: My wife and I really enjoyed the spuds!  My wife had the chicken spud and I had the vegan!  2 thumbs up!
author: Riley S.

description:
Pittsburgher who needed a quick, yet gf meal....and Hot Spud hit the spot! Waitstaff was quick to help and describe possible allergens -- super helpful! Potatoes were baked to perfection -- creamy on the inside and crisp on the outside. Toppings galore to choose from and a great choice of bottled bevies. 

I topped mine with roasted cauliflower, sauteed mushrooms, and peas....the accompanying chipotle lime aoili completed the meal!
author: Heather R.

description:
Finally got to try the spud and it's so yummy!
Previously I had always gotten the fiesta salad which has a cilantro dressing I'm in love with. The spud is a simple concept but it is filling and scrumptious.
In particular I like the chicken spud (without olives and instead add mushrooms). The potato which can be a bit bland is flavored with a nice kick of hot sauce. Ingredients taste really fresh and spuds are made on the spot. 
The sweet potato brownie is also a delicious guilty pleasure. The brownie is a soft and does not have a heavy chocolate taste (which I love) and the sweet potato blends well with the chocolate. 
Hot spud is definitely one of the gems in the heavily touristy areas.
Would definitely recommend!
author: Julia K.

description:
I came here last weekend.

Pros: 
*positive, friendly staff 
*smaller crowds than most other places in the area 
*delicious potatoes

Cons: 
*direct light from the setting sun shining right in your face 
*toilet seat is not attached to the actual toilet 
*paying $50 for four baked potatoes

All told, if it's 6:00pm and every other place within walking distance of the water is incredibly crowded with an hour-long wait (and you can ignore the fact that you could make this same food at home for $3 per person using a microwave) Hot Spud makes for a decent spot to grab a bite.  The staff was very welcoming and accommodating, and everyone in my party of four ate their fill, with no complaints about the flavor.  But whoever owns the place would really do themselves a favor by adding some infrastructure, such as a soda dispenser for fountain drinks, a more intuitive customer traffic pattern, shades on the windows to keep the direct sun out, and a toilet seat with some self respect.
author: Jeff T.

description:
I wanted to go to any restaurant where they have unique eats for lunch right before I head to Chinatown for its flower fair.  Last year, my family and I haven't planned a field trip to travel from our city to Las Vegas or Los Angeles during our staycation.  I would had the chance to go to many interesting eats. :^(.  But, I never worry; still hope for me if I had enough money.  

At Hot Spud, here's one interesting eat I couldn't wait to try: stuffed jacket potato.  I passed by this place on New Year's Day; this time, I came in here to buy a one big jacket potato, just like a baked potato I used to have in Sizzler's, but even bigger for lunchtime.  My stuffed jacket potato I quickly ordered was the Veggie Spud.  I liked to assume my choice of having greens in my spud relate to what's uncontrollably growing out of the big potato in a make up sci-fi movie, a perfect creation for my taste spud.  I chose Alfredo sauce, but that's fine if I end up with a scoop of sour cream unto my Veggie Spud; as long as everything is delicious. With a free cup of water, I finished my meal and leave after that.

Love how Turkish workers make stuffed jacket potatoes.  The ingredients they use are gluten free and MSG free.  Food served like hot potatoes and customer service is excellent.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
The first time I came to Fisherman's Wharf I passed by Hot Spud, but didn't get a chance to try it, so I made sure to put it on my to-do list for the next time. And now here we were! 

- Steak spud: this was such a huge portion! The potato was quite buttery and rich with the Alfredo sauce and cheese on top, layered with morsels of beef, topped with onions and peas. The whole thing was quite heavy (but what was I expecting XP) and one dimensional though, and none of the elements particularly stood out.

I don't think it was anything super out of the ordinary (and not your typical cheap fast food - make your own potato is about $8-9), so I probably won't be back. But it was nice to try Hot Spud, since I've never actually been to a place that exclusively serves baked potatoes (or jacket potatoes, as they call them), so definitely something to check off that bucket list!
author: Joanna C.

description:
If you are gluten-free in San Francisco, your choices can be pretty sparse. So this was a welcome place to eat while we were down near the wharf. Nothing fancy, but a little pricey for what you get--A baked potato with a set of toppings. If you want something plain, you can ask them and they will go off menu, but know that you'll pay $10 to get butter, sour cream and cheese on a potato. 

The chicken comes with buffalo topping, so if you have a wing lover in your party, it's a pretty good bet. They also serve beer and bottled soda.
author: Paula M.

description:
A quick lunch that is relatively inexpensive and hearty one block off the main grid of San Francisco. I got the potato with crab, corn, and spinach.

I give this place a 3...an average 3. The potato and crab were cooked well, but the corn was cold and the spinach was unwashed.....dirt crumbles are not a tasty food spice additive.

Would return if invited, but probably wouldn't suggest it
author: Dan W.

description:
The chipotle of potatoes. Very chipotle-esque. My boyfriend thought we should try this place out since I love potatoes. And this place markets itself as a very healthy place, so why not? 

Right away, we were greeted by a very friendly staff. That's one thing that makes them stand out: they were all nice from start to finish.

You have a choice between taking something already on their menu, or you can make your own. My boyfriend got the shrimp one ($10.95) without black olives, and the worker gave him the option of substituting the black olives for something else.

I made my own. And I'm pretty picky, so all I wanted was a potato with butter, cheese, salt (already included), and bacon ($1.50 additional charge). My create your own was $5.25, but cost extra to include my spinach and bacon. That's not super bad at all for my pickiness.

I was a little disappointed that the spinach was raw and not cooked, because I like the taste of cooked spinach way more than raw spinach. But on the plus side, the potatoes are huge!! Overall, it tasted pretty good. Definitely want to try out more combos if I'm in the area. I can see that this place can become filled, but not too crowded.

NOTE: 3 stars alone for the food because it's good but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. But what really sets it for me is how great the staff treat you and care about you!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I wish they had a place like this in San Diego! There is nothing more satisfying than a baked potato after a half marathon...

I had the shrimp potato and my fiancé had the steak. I was warned that the sauce on the shrimp potato may be hot, but it had the perfect amount of spice! It tasted so yummy with the shrimp. My fiancé devoured his steak potato. The only complaint I have (other than not being in San Diego) is that there was too much sauce on the potato. That's just my opinion, some may be on the saucier side. 

Highly recommend this place if you're around Fisherman's Wharf! You will not regret it!
author: Eileen S.

description:
This restaurant is a new take on subway or chipotle, except with baked potatoes. You can build your own baked potato, starting at around $8.50, and going up to around $12. The potato was a nice change of pace from salads and sandwiches and is big enough for a full meal, but seems a little pricey to pay $10 for a potato with a few toppings. #sfproblems

They also have build your own salads for around $7. 

My suggestion: Also offer baked sweet potatoes
author: Elena K.

description:
First time I visited this place I really liked the place! 
Second time I visited this place I did not like it as much. The vegetables were raw and the meal didn't taste as good.
author: Sairam B.

description: Comfort food at its best! While in the SF area I noticed them and had to give it a try. So glad we did!!! The baked potato was super creamy-yes...a creamy baked potato!  I enjoyed every bite!
author: Felicia C.

description: Found this place on a Celiac website. It's a cute place and the girls inside were very knowledgeable. They seemed to know what they were talking about when it comes to items being gluten-free. We really enjoyed our potato with butter, cheese, green onions, sautéed mushrooms, broccoli, and bacon. It was a great midday lunch. Thank you Blanca and Pilan for a great experience!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Finding food that is plant based and vegan acceptable is a challenge at Embarcadero unless you are looking for garlic fries... Yelp suggested hot spuds and I  gave it a try. The woman who helped me with my order was incredibly nice and knowledgeable on the matter. Her advice was very helpful. She did not offer any vegan cheese or the like so I am not sure if they have any. I did not want any so I didn't ask either. I got a make-your-own spud with fresh Spinach, broccoli, tomatoes, olives and extra avocado. And I recommend the Thai peanut sauce!! The potato skin was nice and salty,  I was happy with my meal. I didn't think it was spectacular but filled me up, was tasty and felt good.
author: Anna P.

description: The food and service were awesome. The workers were friendly and helpful to make the suggestions from the menu we choose. We will definitely come back here again in the future.
author: Kristopher H.

description: Everyone at one point in their life wishes there was a place where you can get only a really filling and heavy-topped baked potato for a reasonable price and this place is that place. It was amazing and the baked potato with crab was exquisite.
author: Nathaniel B.

description:
First time visited due to it was right across of our hotel and yelp rating was good, this is personal opinion, it was not so good as it described as yelps rating. First of all, pricey 2adult and 2childs: $52 for fast food. Second, you could literally make this better at home, of course. Lastly, salad was disappointment. Crunch Thai salad? No crunch at all with minimal flavor. But taste was fairly okay. 
Like I mentioned it is personal opinion, my son liked it.
author: Soo L.

description:
Super cool place. I've never been to a place that just specialized in Potatoes. My girlfriend has, but it was in Ireland. That should give you some context. For a place specializing in potatoes, I thought the quality was very good. I got a potato with steak, peas, carrots, mushrooms, olives, and some kind of sauce that almost remind me of Alfredo, but not quite.

Overall I would come here for a quick lunch again, no question.
author: Sam R.

description: Quick service. Simple, delicious food with many topping options. Sweet potato brownies weren't available but is one of the spud desserts. The ambiance was fast food bland. Reasonable prices.
author: Emily B.

description: I got the signature dish, steak spud. It has steak, alfredo sauce, potato, scallion, corn, peas, melted cheese inside a roasted potato. It was all right after a long day of hiking. It fufilled my cravings :) There's also a "make your own spud" with the items you wanted to add into your potato. It's abit like chipotle style when you make your own. They also have potato desserts as well, which seemed interesting..
author: Lynh N.

description: Yum yum.my Mom sister and I were looking for something gluten free and ran into this place. The food was amazing the service was great. I would for sure be eating here again
author: Tfabulous R.

description:
Cheesy, buttery, fatty baked potato goodness!  Our office had Hot Spuds catered to us through Chewse and it was delish!  They accommodated for those who are dairy free and vegan as well, and offered greens for a no carb option.  

The potatoes were served piping hot and were huge.    They were moist too.  Loved the make your own potato bar.  Topped mine off with sour cream, chives, some feta cheese, grilled chicken and beef, tomatoes, sautéed mushrooms and bell peppers.  The meats were well seasoned.  The toppings were fresh and pleased everyone's palettes.  It was a very filling and tasty lunch.  I just wished that they also offered more sauces (only had a thousand island like sauce and buffalo sauce) or a Greek yogurt option substitute for sour cream.
author: Cat C.

description: Vegan options!!! Make your own potatoes! The best part is the amazing service. They were all sweet and accommodating. Friends got a shrimp and sausage and they loved it. The buffalo sauce is vegan and AMAZING. Definitely recommend!!
author: Crystal F.

description:
Get your potato on! 
I was walking the streets of Fisherman's Wharf, looking for a non fussy and quick place to grab a bite when their logo caught my eye. I am a fan of everything with potato and it looked like they had interesting toppings to go with it. 
You order at the counter and they bring the food to you. I got chipotle shrimp hot spud. I only wished there was a little more cheese on it. But maybe it was healthier that way? I really enjoyed the skin of my spud. It was lightly salted and chewy. 
I really recommend to stop by here if you are in the area and feel like getting something different than your typical FW chowder and seafood.
author: Magdalena K.

description:
Great family owned place
Yummiest spud ever
Great vegetarians options, we loved our spud with corn, spinach, green onions and avacado
We would come here again
author: Soofia F.

description: This place is sooooo good and it's so different! It's your traditional baked potato but with better options and better toppings! I got The Wharf spud and added shrimp, you pay a little extra for the shrimp but it's worth it for the extra seafood in the potato. I've also tried the Steak spud which is not as good as The Wharf but it's still better than any other baked potato I've had. I like how they put a different twist on something we've known for years. I would definitely recommend checking this place out because I don't know any other place like it!
author: Alysha D.

description: This restaurant needs to open another one in FiDi/SOMA! There are so many employees in downtown who are yearning for healthy and cheap food. This is the best food I've had under $15 which satisfied my nutrition goal and also had good taste. If it is in SOMA, I will probably go there 5 times a week.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: Food is pricey for what you get . I ordered a couple of shrimp and chicken spuds for my family and the amount of meat and sea food was very less . Each dish was priced at 10-11 dollars and I could get much better food for the money I paid here if I had the time to look around for more options . Shrimp has just 4 small shrimps in it and chicken a few pieces here and there..
author: Swati S.

description: Our first visit to the bay area. We found this place to be a great stop for lunch. I have two have two lovely ladies in my life that have celiac (gluten free) not a choice but a must have. This was a welcome place to eat down by the wharf. It's not fancy but very simply a baked potato with good toppings.
author: Raymond W.

description: FULL AS F$&K This place hit the spot the topping were a lil weird being cold the peas and corn I wonder if the can warm those up but I'll definitely return I had the steak and I add chicken perfect combo more then enough toppings get extra sour cream cause it's a huge potato but it reminds me of home the way the potatoes are roasting in the oven I'd come here to study or write!
author: Rolin S.

description:
In an area that is seafood based - this place was a blessing! 

Their baked potatoes are HUGGEEE! And they have a LOT of options. Essentially it is a build your own potato bar which lets you decide what you want to eat. My suggestion is to get a baked potato with Alfredo sauce as the topping. You will not regret coming here! 

As well very friendly staff.
author: Amit T.

description:
Awesome service, welcomed as soon as we walked in the door
and spud was delicious  
we had veggie and the chicken 1.
Price was right too
author: Kristy W.

description: The hot spud potato based dished remained me dishes that are served in North India with butter and pepper. So Yummy.  It is a simple recipe which is loaded with vegetables and cheese.
author: Srini K.

description:
I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is searching for a big hearty meal. You get to customize a giant potato by choosing all your toppings. There is a variety of choices regarding meats, veggies, cheeses, and sauces.

The service was nice, the workers are very sweet and helpful.

*I also tried the sweet potato brownie and it was delicious*
author: Gloria P.

description: This was an awesome place to eat great food, courteous service , and it's just awesome I love it thank you for the great service hot Spud!
author: Kim L.

description:
We were on our way to hotel at Fishermen's area and saw that place. I am not sure the business run by Turkish people or not but the food is almost "Kumpir" which is a baked potato stuffed with some meat and vegetables and kind of a street food in Turkey. Being far from home, we wanted to give a try. 

They were almost closing at wait was 10 minutes for next potato but somehow they made it faster. To go containers are good quality. We paid about $12 for the one with meat, meat cubes were a bit chewy but overall taste is okay. They have many seats to dine in.
author: Ceren A.

description:
When craving a baked potato, chances are that if you come upon this place you will be enticed to enter. Yes, I fell for the gimmick, and rightly so. I was hungry and in need of carbs. This place suited me just fine, but in hindsight, you really can make your own at home for way cheaper. 

I got a loaded baked potato with butter, shrimp, broccoli, sautéed mushrooms, cheese, and sauce on the side. The spud wasn't bad. It was a nice size and filling however it lacked flavor, and I would have preferred more butter. But it still wasn't too bad and got the job done? Would I do it again? Eh, probably not. Nevertheless, if you're a tourist with a hankering for spuds with toppings, this is the spot!

Likes:
-convenience
-unique idea
-interesting toppings

Dislikes:
-cost
-lack of flavor 
-a bit expensive
author: Tracy T.

description: Been there a few times and is outstanding service, nice employees and good food. Never fails to impress. Although the seating area is small, the food makes up for it. Usually not too packed. Would highly recommend it to anyone stopping by.
author: Jacob B.

description:
Went Easter Sunday after getting off the Big Bus On/Off Tour bus.  Meet the owner and he explained the concept to us.  We ordered and got a great meal!  Will definitely go back when I am back in SFO.  

Food was fresh.  And they know how to make something without cheese (my wife has an allergy to cheese)!

Good experience.
author: Brian B.

description:
When craving to eat potato, this is the place to go. The place is clean and bright with the menu right in front of you when you walk in through the door. Someone will take down your order and give you a slip with your order to go down to the left where you pay and pick up your order.

I ordered the steak spud without black olives (not my favorite) and end up getting the sweet potato cheesecake and the sweet potato cheesecake to try as well.

The steak spud was very filling and delicious. Definitely a better choice than the some of the other fast food places around the wharf. With its reasonable prices and friendly service, this is indeed a good place to try, and maybe just maybe, you might find that you like the food too.
author: Jen M.

description:
I ordered the veggie potato with chipotle sauce. At first, I was hesitant because of the price but once the potato came out, I could see the price was worth it by the size of the potato! The potato itself was delicious and creamy. 

The service was efficient and friendly but the only negative comment I could make was that the veggies on my potato were cold and would have preferred them warmed.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Craving a large hearty baked potato with ALL the fixins but don't have time to make it yourself? Go to HOT SPUD! I live in Hayes Valley and will make the trek to touristy wharf just for this! For me it's worth it. Significantly better than the baked potatoes at the cheesesteak place at the food court in Stonestown mall.  I LOVE that you can see all the possible toppings and tell them what you want on it.  Even better.. the basics are included (butter, salt, cheese, etc.). 

I typically reserve 5 stars for extraordinary experiences. I would like to give this place 4.5 stars but since I can't and it's been such a favorite spot for years it deserves a stellar review. 

I usually get butter, salt and pepper, cheese, scallions, sautéed mushrooms, bacon, sour cream, and occasionally will add either peas, corn, steak, shrimp, or Alfredo sauce.  SO DELICIOUS! Grab and go enjoy your heart potato lunch in a nearby park!
author: Mel D.

description:
We stopped into Hot Spud for lunch while wandering around the shops near Fisherman's Wharf and had a decent bite to eat.

Décor: It's a small shop with just a few seats to stay and eat, most seemed to grab and go, but it's clean and flooded with natural light. The ambiance is chill and relaxed and it's a nice change from all the tourists wandering around outside. The menu is large and can't be missed and there was not a large line at all when we were there. In fact, it was very quiet (not sure why).
Bathroom: unknown

Staff: Everyone was nice and friendly, willing to help with any questions.

Food: The potato was PERFECTLY cooked and delicious! I had the buffalo chicken one and it was very, very tasty. I just had it as it comes and a cup of free water. It was a solid little lunch that filled me up pretty well indeed.

Value: The do not overprice their spuds here. You leave with a satisfied belly and a wallet that still has some cash in it.

I enjoyed this lunch spot and would return in the future. However, I'd try a few more places first.
author: Mark B.

description:
Great concept!! Came here for a quick bite. I tried the chicken spud and it was better than I expected.  The ingredients were fresh and a lot different toppings to customize your own baked potato. It's more like a twice-baked potatoes. The insides of the potato is mashed and combined with ingredients and then topped with more ingredients.  A great comfort food.
I also tried their sweet potato brownie.  It was light and airy. Not too sweet. The sweet potato really worked well in the brownie. . 
Overall, love this place for when I'm feeling for some comfort food.

PS- Skip the restroom if you don't need to use it. It's not the cleanest
author: stella c.

description:
What an excellent concept. This makes for fora great quick lunch or snack before going in the big bus tours or just grabbing something to est. 

It's tasty and satisfying and you do not have to feel gross afterward. I had the veggie spud but I wish I had gotten the shrimp spud because my husband's was delicious! 

These potatoes are huge too so hope you brought somewhat of an appetite. 
I can see this place coming up with great new spud ideas like maybe shrimp jambalaya or something fun.

The staff was very friendly and helpful, my only complaints were that it was kind of warm in this place and there is no ice for beverages. But otherwise a great place to grab a bite :-)
author: Nasha W.

description: San Francisco has an embarrassment of great eating experiences. The competitive dining environment as well as the enormous food choices in the city, mean that if an establishment is not delivering a high quality product, it will not be long before the word gets out, and the eatery will either improve or fold. Hot Spud gets that all to well. A cozy location blocks from the pier means it sees a lot of foot traffic, but being just off the pier, it can be missed. Someone decided to take me there and I was not disappointed, in fact the first taste of my gourmet steak potato was pure delight. The ingredients are fresh, the steak tender,and all the toppings add to an incredible offering.
author: Jimmy L.

description: They should call this place Super Spud. If you're not wharf-bound specifically for a bread bowl or some Ghirardelli, get food here! Check construction blocks it, but it's still open. For anyone wondering, the chicken spud's sauce isn't too hot, so don't let that put you off.
author: Alex B.

description: This place was definitely exactly as I expected haha. You get a giant potato completely covered in various toppings. I got the veggie spud which had generous helpings of corn, broccoli, and other veggies. I got the hot wings sauce but they only gave very little so I dumped a bunch of tapatio sauce on everything. There was also only a little cheese which was pretty disappointing. The potato could have also been baked a little longer. It was pretty good but would have been amazing if the insides were softer and the edges crispier. Very filling for the price and the restaurant, tho not very exciting or extravagant, was very clean
author: Jackie P.

description: So delicious! This place does Gluten free well and my MIL did not get "sick" from any cross contamination. We all got the shrimp potato and it was super delicious and a huge portion. Will visit again.
author: Danielle W.

description: Great spud! We had the chicken and steak spuds. They were massive and we didn't need to eat for the rest of the day! Plenty to power us up for the ride around the waterfront and across the bridge. The addition of hot sauce made it extra special. Yum!
author: Amber W.

description: Interesting concept. Ordered steak spud. Pretty delicious and filling. A bit on the expense side given it is a fast food store.
author: Y C.

description: I got the veggie spud and boy was I disappointed. Maybe it had something to do with us doing a take-out or maybe that we were the last order of the day. But the spud was bad. Bland, flavorless and dry :/
author: Sagar J.

description: Pretty good place (not great but good) reminds me of a Subway Resturant for spuds.  Starts with a base and you build from there.  Everything was fine but not outstanding. The potato was cooked well but the toppings (we got veggies) are cold.  Feels kind of weird in the mouth.  If they would roast the corn, grill the veggies it would definitely take things up a notch.  Not convinced local products are being used much, as rows of cans line the wall in the prep kitchen.
author: Sharon J.

description: Pretty solid food at a reasonable price. Especially given the area that it is in. The ordering process is a bit slow though
author: Xiao W.

description:
Four and a half stars, round up to 5.
5.5 stars for the brownies. Worth the visit alone.

4 stars for the potato. It was as good as a potato could be but I'm not sure any potato could fully get me to 5 stars.  

Definitely would go again and the staff is awesome.
author: Greg A.

description: love love love this place. this is maybe my third or fourth time coming and I'm hooked. so hooked I had to hop on here and do a review! the price might seem a lot at first, but they're definitely worth it! delicious and hits the spot every single time.
author: Heather H.

description: We walked past this restaurant and stopped in here for lunch. It was a great find. They have found so many different ways to prepare a potato. You can also customize it to your liking. The service is excellent and the food was very tasty. My daughter described it best - "it's like subway, but for potato's"
author: Nadia G.

description:
Love this place!
We had super friendly service, and completely safe gluten-free meals which tasted great! Lots of options to choose from, drink selection was perfect, and we sat at the window and watched the people go by as we ate. We will absolutely be back next time we visit San Francisco!
author: Erik K.

description: Awesome FOOD!! Baked potatoes on crack!! Definitely a must stop!!! Priced perfectly!!
author: Jos J.

description:
Nearly every table was dirty, the walls  and doors to the bathroom were black and grimy.
Would not here again, food not very good.
author: K. K.

description: Hands down best tater I've had. They allowed me to try the different sauce toppings, it was honestly a perfect dinner.
author: Amanda P.

description: Nice place to crave something different.  Make sure you are really clear with your order, they are quickly writing down what you are saying in code, and 2 of our 3 orders were wrong.
author: David H.

description: Went here this past weekend and loved it! The man who helped me, helped me create a vegan order and it was delicious! Or as we would say back in Taiwan, 很好吃! (hěnho chī!) :D
author: Xiang P.

description: A really good spot to stop by if you're hungry for some cheesy potato goodness. We got the Veggie Spud and it was really good! Definitely get the sour  cream on top since it really ties in all the flavors together...
author: Sneha K.

description:
I expected more from this place. I am in love with the turkish concept behind this joint, but I was disappointed this time.

We ordered the wharf (crab), the shrimp and the steak spuds. The crab was okay; my girlfriend liked it more than I did. The shrimp was really good, but I wish it came with more shrimp. The steak spud was disappointing because the steak was pretty dry. It was close to closing time so maybe that was a factor that contributed to the dryness of the steak.

Hot Spud, you owe us a juicy steak spud!
author: Omar A.

description: The food tasted good but the shrimp spud had exactly 4 pieces of extra small shrimp. I mean come on you are located in pier 39 and sell a backed potato at the price of all you can eat buffet where you can have unlimited baked potatoes, the least you can do is add a good portion of shrimp
author: Jibo N.

description:
I've been passing this place for a long time but the people I hang out with never wanted to eat here. I'm finally here with someone who will eat here with me!

Seriously the most expensive baked potato I've ever eaten but it was really good! It's exactly what I expected and imagined it would be.

I would come again for the food, but not too frequently for the price.
author: Karen P.

description: The food was wonderful very delicious, the girl that took my order was very nice however it was a bit in the dirty side. Or else it would have been 5 stars
author: Daniel A.

description:
- delicious chicken spud, plenty of food after a morning of walking
- friendly staff
- different vibe than the rest of the tourist traps nearby
- one star off for cleanliness
author: Mari E.

description: As others have said, the people who work here are super friendly.  The food is really fresh and you can make the potato have whatever toppings you want.  It is a terrific quick and inexpensive option in a very touristy area.
author: Stacy C.

description: The chicken spud. It is all about the chicken spud.  Sooooooo good!  Oh if this place was in a more convenient location than the warf I would come here all the time.
author: Daniel A.

description:
My potato was created to amazing goodness. I tried the veggie one with all the free toppings. Sooo good. Definitely a must try and the price is really good for the area (fisherman's wharf). 

If you order online they had some kind of promo as well for $10 off your order of $15+ for your first online order.
author: Herman S.

description: This place makes a great bite to eat if you're tired of the crowds and fast food! The baked potatoes are huge and creamy, and the staff is lovely. I can't really say anything about the price since I get a discount for working on Fisherman's Wharf, but if you're looking to maintain a budget, get the basic Create Your Own spud without the meat. You get all the free ingredients, four veggie choices, and a sauce - still really tasty and filling! I personally get a spud with mushrooms, spinach, peas, and currants with the chipotle tartar sauce. They also offer free cups of water if you're thirsty, so points for that.
author: Brandi R.

description: Pleasantly surprised. Fast, good quality food. Worth the value especially in Fisherman's Wharf
author: Lyn D.

description: Hot Spud was awesomely good! Wifey ordered the chicken and I got the steak. Each bite was full of flavor. A nice mix of ooey gooey cheesy goodness, heaping loads of sour cream, meats, and veggies made this one hell of a meal.
author: Brian B.

description: Hot Spud was just what I was looking for when  I entered the premises with 6 hungry 12-year-old boys. They took the rather complicated orders with ease (each kid wanted different toppings) and they had so many workers behind the bar all the food was done in a jiffy. The manager was very nice (I mean, I had SIX twelve year old boys! He probably wasn't thrilled!) and the kids enjoyed the meal. More details: the place wasn't sparkling, but clean enough. The tables were taller and placed all around the room, so the diners all could each without being on top of each other.
author: Cate R.

description: One of the best spots at Fisherman's Whraf. Food was extremely delicious and prices were low. Try the special one with shrimps, absolutely unique.
author: Ilker D.

description: Best cheesecake ever----AND it is gluten free!!! So glad I don't live here or I would want to go pick one up every.single.freaking.day.
author: Sheri R.

description: Wow!! The potatoes are good, and I don't even like potatoes. That says something about this place. I was hesitant when I saw the prices though but when the potatoes came, I can see why! They came out loaded and generous of toppings. I had "The Wharf" with crab meat in it and some lemon sauce, which I don't exactly recall the name, but I recommend it. It's really good. Husband had the chicken spud which has some kind of hot wing sauce on it, and he said it was good.  We didn't try the dessert yet, but, if we have time, we're for sure going back for the dessert.
author: Daisy S.

description: You will, in fact, receive a hot spud when you come here. Hot Spot is like a Chipotle, but with fluffy baked potatoes instead of burritos. I got the traditional - just chives, butter, cheese and bacon, and it was a satisfying little lunch. The niece got something with shrimp, which might sound like a weird combo, but she ate it and enjoyed it. (I think. Teenagers tend to be less communicative than we would like.)
author: Han C.

description:
Hot Spud is like a Chipotle but for potatoes instead of burritos. The idea seems cool but in reality it is still just baked potatoes with toppings (lots of toppings). It is just not something to get too excited about unless you are a real potato lover.

Tried the Shrimp Spud and the Wharf. The shrimp one was tasty. The sauce has a good amount of kick and the toppings went well with the potato. The Wharf, on the other hand, got boring quickly. There were not a whole lot of crab meat to go around and the sauce was mellow. I wanted to redress my potato with some extra condiments but found nothing of interest. 

Even though I am not in the camp of potato lovers, I must say that they did a great job baking the spuds. The texture was soft and flaky all the way to the skin.
author: Mona W.

description:
Tried this place after randomly seeing it while walking around. Since I'm a potato lover... it called out to me. I looked it up on Yelp real quick, saw good reviews and decided try it. At first I was a bit thrown off by the price but wanted to try it anyways. I'm sure glad I tried it! 

My brother and I decided to split the steak baked potato since we were on our way to get clam chowder at the pier. It's a good thing we split it because it was big!! The guy did not go cheap on the toppings and I loved how they mash the potato instead a bit for you with cheese. The steak tasted good and was tender. A steak potato came with steak, peas, corn, cheese, sour cream, onions and we added bacon. I devoured my half and combined with my calm chowder and coffee, I was beyond stuffed!

This is not your run of the mill baked potato from the restaurants. They have about 5 or 6 baked potato combos or you can customize your own. If you create your own, it will start at about $7.50. For a combo potato, it's about $10, and with bacon, came out to be about $11. It's 65 cents an extra topping. After getting the potato, I did not feel that it was as expensive as I had originally thought since it's a pretty big potato. I would come here again next time I'm on the pier!! I saw their Thai Crunch salad and it looked really good. I will have to try that next time!!
author: Carol N.

description: First time at Hot Spud. The taters are great with a ton of topping options. I had a salad that was really good also.
author: Jer-Ray S.

description:
No hand soap in bathroom means employees can't have clean hands. Slow service despite slow business.

Shrimp spud was good though.
author: Richard L.

description: Had my first hearty baked potato experience here (other than my failed attempts at home with a microwave)! Every warm bite was a mouthful of sweet corn, soft potatoes, savory bacon, and bits of chicken! The price was about $10, not bad considering how close it is to the touristy Fisherman's Wharf area. The tables were clean, and the customer service was nice and quick. The staff spoke in an energetic, welcoming manner. I loved how casual and welcoming it was. Both the customer service and taste of the food were overall heartwarming and memorable. Will definitely come back again!
author: Jane S.

description: I came in about half an hour before close and they had to make more potatoes--20 mins, they said. Pelin was so sweet and knowledgeable about what ingredients I could have (I'm vegan) that I didn't even mind the wait. I expected it since it was nearing the end of the day. She piled on my veggies--I need them for a long night of studying. Thanks Pelin!
author: Danica N.

description: If u enjoy baked potatoes, then you'll enjoy this place. It's a bit pricey for my wallet, but I've found that in SF nothing is cheap (I come from LA). But I really enjoyed my spud!
author: DEBB D.

description:
Fast
Great 
Clean
Easy to find 
Worth every penny 
Second time I was there even better
author: Mukhammadiev B.

description:
After spending some time in Edinburgh and enjoying their great wealth of jacket potato shops, I was really hoping to find something like that back here. After a little searching, I found Hot Spud. 

The good: Hot Spud is super cheap, has tons of toppings, and the food is great. If you ever find yourself dining with a vegetarian or gluten-free person, it's a great place to go because there are tons of options that suit those diets. They're also very generous with toppings, and portions are large enough for all but the biggest gluttons.

The bad: Since it's right by the Embarcadero, you can be super close and still need 20 minutes to navigate around all the tourists and get into a parking spot. I got lucky once and found a metered spot, but on my second trip we ended up using a paid lot. It was $5 for every 30 minutes, and it took us about 20-25 minutes to eat and get back to the car.

The restaurant was also really dirty both times we went. Tables and counters just didn't seem to get wiped down quickly after people used them, and there was a garbage smell wafting in the door that was a little gross. If you're concerned about dirty tables, bring a wet wipe or dampen a napkin. 

The desserts were also not terribly appetizing, maybe because it's harder to bake good gluten-free desserts. They just looked dried out. On the other hand, if you're gluten-free and used to not having many dessert options, you might think they're great.

It might sound like I have way more negatives than positives, but I do feel like the food and insanely cheap prices outweigh the bad stuff. Still, I wanted to outline both sides of things because it may not be an acceptable tradeoff for others.
author: Stefanie H.

description: Most amazing potatoe I've had ever! Got the shrimp spud and man it's packed with flavor not only on top of that the customer service is amazing. If I'm ever back in The City I'm for sure stopping back at this place!!
author: Joshua P.

description: Great gluten food option for a quick and healthy meal! Salads offered too! Good customer service.
author: M A.

description: Service: excellent. very courteous and helpful and cooperative with special needs. Food: SPUDS ARE AWESOME! Great portion with a bunch of combos and toppings that mix well. The fiesta salad was excellent! The dressing was sooo superb and all the foods are well portioned. Worth it. Go try it only $8-10 a plate
author: Vanesha T.

description: Delicious fast vegetarian and meat lovers meals. I had a mix of both worlds vegetarian spud with bacon, Chipotle sauce and sour cream. Delicious!!!! Highly recommended from an aussie spud meal connoisseur.
author: Em G.

description:
This place was right around the corner from our hotel. It's in a nice central area right near Fishermans wharf. 

We went there about 30 minutes before closing, and they were very accommodating and welcoming. I choose the shrimp spud, and it was tasty and the flavours were there. The potato flesh was mixed with cheese which was a nice tasty surprise. And the potato skin was nice and crispy.

Overall it was tasty and satisfying but there is only so much potato that I can take. It was definitely good value for money because the potato was huge!! I got bored towards the end but Never the less it was tasty. If I was in San Fran again I would go back!
author: Peter A.

description:
A warm welcome, I felt very much at ease, beautiful interior. It was very good. I enjoyed the service thoroughly and the food was amazing! I will most likely come here again very soon!
I would highly recommend this establishment considering the total picture, tasty food, good service, decent pricing.
author: Amelia K.

description:
Who doesn't love a baked potato bar??   

Hot Spud is a fast casual restaurant (a la chipotle style) where you can build your own baked potato.  Everything here, including the sweet potato cheesecake and brownie, is gluten free, which is amazing!  I got the baked potato with spinach, avocado and broccoli- delish!  The potatoes are cooked to perfection (seems like I can never be that patient at home)...moist but not mushy.  Thoroughly enjoyed my meal!
author: Cassie P.

description:
Potato Lover 4lyfe. 

I  ate two potatoes within a 6 hour time period. definitely the best stuffed potatoes I've ever eaten in my life, and I've had my fair share. Hot spuds was located right under my hotel room and as I passed by I knew I had to try them. So sad today is my last day in San Francisco. Please open in the LA area.
author: Ary Z.

description:
Really cool idea for a restaurant. Execution was just a wee bit weak though. Potato wasn't especially great. It's San Francisco, I just can't imagine needing to go here with so many places around the Fisherman's Wharf area. It's not that much cheaper than the other nearby restaurants either. 

I will say though it's fun. And totally worth coming up with your own fun combination. Go with friends. Make it fun. Just don't expect really top notch quality. It's just good.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Potatoes, hot and tasty. If you come here you'll get a large potatoes cooked hot and soft (not mushy) and a bazillion ways to dress it up. Better yet, the service was friendly and out to please....  While I was wondering if there was enough cheese on mine (it was hidden under some of my toppings) one of the cooks did not hesitate to throw more cheese on mine to make me happy.

Great bet for something savoury and fast. If you want starch after pigging out at the nearby Ghirardelli factory, this is an excellent counterbalance.  

P.S. bar seats have outlets for charging!
author: GB M.

description: Love this place! I used to come all the time in high school but sadly this location is out of the way for me. I'm still glad I got to come back recently because the spuds are still very delicious. I ordered the chicken spud and it was amazing. So cheesy and full of flavor. I had bacon in mine which I'm not sure if they added in on accident but it was a nice addition. My bf had the steak spud and he loved it. I wish this place wasn't so far so I could frequent it more often. Prices have gone up since the last time I've been here 4-5 years ago but it is reasonable considering this is Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Lushi Z.

description: Excellent for a very filling quick bite. The spicy tartar sauce on the shrimp spud had just enough kick.
author: Wanda C.

description:
Before I was forced to go gluten free a year ago, I would have said a hot potato restaurant would be a horrible idea. Now that I am gluten free, this concept is the best idea since sliced bread (all puns intended).

Hot spud serves 100% gluten free baked potatoes in a variety of styles to match your craving. Chicken, steak, or veggie style they have multiple ways to satisfy your hunger. You can also make your potato to order interactively picking and choosing your toppings from the several meats and vegetables they have for toppings.

The staff here was very efficient and quickly assembled my order of 3 potatoes. 

I recommend the chicken.  It had a touch of spicy buffalo sauce that added the perfect kick.

I'm very happy I stopped in for dinner and can't wait until they start opening some of these locations on the east coast. I need some more "go to" lunch locations and this chain would certainly fit the bill.
author: Aaron T.

description: Great tasting spuds with many options and good price. Service was also great! I would eat here again
author: Alan Z.

description: This place is in Fishermans Wharf in San Francisco, and as  cool as the wharf is this place just made it even Better!! This is a must try!! I highly recommend it. We ordered  two potatoes one with shrimp (forgot the name) and one with crab (The Wharf). Both were to die for very fresh shrimp very fresh crab very large potato very fresh food awesome toppings everything was A1. Because I was with my friend and it was our 1st time we each got our own so we could sample them both, but one definitely was big enough to share. The staff greeted us immediately immediately when we came in and walked us through the sort of salad bar of toppings and let us make it to order removing and adding what we did not want the staff was very friendly very helpful and also offered a variety of potato desserts (sweet potatoe cheesecake and a chocolate/sweet potato brownie) I will return and so should you!!!!
author: Maya B.

description:
Eat here!!!! Delicious and large portions!! You can taste the freshness of the food and it is well priced!
We had the Caesar salad and the steak bud - both of which I'd eat again!!
author: Alyssa J.

description: Okay so this place has the key phrase vegan. THIS PLACE IS NOT VEGAN AT ALL. They serve lots of potatoes and chicken and beef and crab and bacon and cheese. All I was able to eat was beer and a Thai salad which was okay but not very good for $10. Go somewhere else or you'll be a sad disappointed hungry vegan. @Hot Spud--remove vegan from your key phrases OR add some actual vegan food to your menu
author: Megan T.

description: This place has a real cool concept...came to grab a quick bite which was perfect for my girlfriend and I.We had the Steak Spud,brew, and Hazeltnut rice pudding. Hit the spot.
author: Sosa O.

description: After 5 years this place is still awesome. Returned to San Fran and had to visit! Got the Wharf with crab and my husband got the Chicken one with Alfredo sauce. He was so impressed at how good it tasted. Still one of my favorites!
author: Daniella W.

description: Super delis! Light n perfection=D Great for this San Francisco weather. Price is right and walking distance from our hotel n pier
author: Jessica V.

description: Walked in about 10 minutes prior to close and was told it would be to go only . No big deal , but felt rushed to place our order. Potatoes aren't anything special but we're tasty . For me the menu seemed a little limited , especially with all the possibilities you have with a potato .
author: Greg E.

description:
The spud with shrimp is really really good! The shrimp is cooked to perfection and when it hits your taste buds, you ill be forever happy.

I love treating myself after a long day of classes on Tuesdays. I think I've earned it.

ummmm hmmmmm
author: Court S.

description: Great food, unique experience, fair prices. My wife and I both had The Wharf. It was loaded with crab and had a nicely paired sauce. Very tasty and filling. Reminded me of a chip place in England.
author: Robert R.

description:
Unique San Fran food at it's best.  Where else are you going to get a potato covered in excellent shrimp, chipotle tartar sauce, corn and olives?  It's a really unique dish and a very affordable lunch destination.  

They have a good selection of unique bottled soda/beer as well.  The food options are pretty varied as well, and you can also create your own custom potato as well.  The available toppings include bacon, steak, chicken, sausage, shrimp, crab, avocado, a variety of cheeses, and so much more.  There should be something for everyone, unless you don't like potatoes.  Then you're probably out of luck.
author: Curtis C.

description:
Great concept and a well appreciated departure from the usual fast-food. The staff was friendly and the food was finished really quick and fresh.
We were unsure about the size of the portions after looking at the pictures. Let me tell you: it is plenty. Not to forget that it tastes very good. We had the sausage and the BBQ chicken spud. 
On top, when you are looking for a gluten-free meal, this place is ideal.
author: Sven D.

description: My partner and I were on a mission to find a really good snack to hit the spot while on the pier. Found this place and it did just that! Staff were friendly and a bit flirtatious  they weren't in a rush to charge us and made us feel very welcome. Chill atmosphere and good music, couldn't take more than two bites without singing along. The food was bomb! Cajun Shrimp Spud and the Warf Spud were on point. The shrimps were a bit spicy just like I like it! Underneath the shrimp was a good sized spud topped with green onion, corn, black olives on the side and cheese. Decided to pass on the sour cream but finger licking good nonetheless. The Warf Spud was very tasty to my liking. I could do without the mound of purple onion but the green onion, sour cream, crab meat, and corn were satisfying. Will defiantly hit up this spot.
author: LeleAndJenJen ..

description:
My gf brought one over to my house for lunch. I reheated it up in the microwave and it still tasted good. 

SHRIMP SPUD -Grilled shrimp, chipotle tartar sauce, corn, black olives, green onion-Minus  the olives. Yuck. The chipotle tartar sauce is what makes it taste good. They give alot so it covers your whole potato. For over $11 for a bake potato with only 4 itty little pieces of shrimp...not sure if it is worth it.
author: Karen H.

description:
The colors reminded me of Sbarros and the set up is basically a Subway/Chipotle...for potatoes.  I don't think this place is so good that you should go out of your way to visit but they definitely know how to make their potatoes! The potatoes they use are big and are cooked well. The guy making my baked potato didn't skimp on any of the toppings and stuffed it full. 

It was a nice change for me since the only time I really eat baked potatoes is if I make it myself at home. This place is around the corner from the Boudins (across the street from the Wharf Inn) and if you're in the mood for a little non-seafood snack, then this is a good place to check out.
author: Tina M.

description: Let me just start off that this may be biased.  I love potatoes in all forms and you could put pretty much anything on a potato and I'll still enjoy it.  I got the wharf which had crab and corn and other things I'd never imagine on a potato but DAMN - it was good.  I scarfed that bad boy down in maybe 15 minutes and almost wanted another one.  Thank goodness this isn't in my hometown or I'd be superfat.
author: Julie P.

description: I had the wharf potato with all the included add-ons (butter, sour cream, cheese). It was delicous. I was worried it would be a lot of onions but it turned out great. I did need about 8 mints after but it was worth it.
author: Brandi W.

description: Finding a spud cafe in US made us happy. We chose the veggie one. The spud was delicious but a bit different from Turkish concept. For example i have never eaten a spud with green onion & broccoli:)  Green onion was well-matched with spud but broccoli not. They can add more pickle and corn in it. The staffs were friendly and helpful.
author: Zehra A.

description:
Not quite fast food but not quite a restaurant. Made fresh to order, I made my own with 5 or 6
Ingredients and it came out great. Unique / Nice choice in an area with a lot of the same choices. Worth a look!
author: Mike C.

description: Good food. Served in chipotle style boxes with potatoes. Portion sizes are large and it's quite filling. Definitely worth a try!
author: Piyush K.

description: Who doesn't love a perfectly made hot Spud what the perfect array of toppings. I most definitely recommend trying at least once!
author: Layla W.

description:
Yum! Great idea. Fun spot to get a huge baked potato! It's not cheap, but the toppings are fun and delicious. People working there were really nice. Will go again! 

They should get something to put on the bottom of their chairs though. they are so loud on the tile floor. Like crazy loud. 

Everything is GF, another bonus for the GF people in my family.
author: Keri V.

description: Contrary to most reviews here, the jacket potatoes are not anything to shout about. Potatoes had very little flavor. Wouldn't bother visiting again.
author: Jeremy H.

description: No exaggeration, they are the best fast food restaurant at Fisherman's warf. I'm their reguler customer and have tried their chicken, steak, vegie and shrimp spud so far. All of them were super delicious. Stuff is friendly and place is really clean. They are not like reguler fast food restaurant, only prices are like fast food restaurants but the rest of all is A+ quality. Thanks  guys for awesome food and service!
author: Osman K.

description: Fantastic! My only wish would be that the potato itself was a bit hotter (so it can super melt everything together). But seriously, that's a very small complaint.
author: Cori N.

description:
Simple, healthy and very tasty. Good job guys!!
I created my own, with not much of toppings, it's just perfect. And all this for a reasonable price.
author: Pika C.

description: Excellent vegetarian options available at this spot. I love baked potatoes and hot spud serves it up perfectly with multiple sauces and toppings to make it delicious. We stepped in to try 1 and as a group of 3 ended up 4 different combinations based on their vegetarian selections. All the other options have meat but they offer flexibility, fantastic service and a quick meal when needed.
author: Anisha A.

description:
Up four from three Yelp stars - one extra star simply for a solid lunch/diner spot among the sea of disappointing Wharf eateries. 

Good spuds. Decent salads. Friendly service. And fast.

Most of their ingredients are regional/local. Don't be afraid to make your own potato - this way you'll get exactly what you want. And know that they'll do half size salads!
author: Mark M.

description:
Probably the best value ($7-$10) and healthiest dining option for tourists and hotel guests in the Fisherman's Wharf area. And the only choice for anyone who requires gluten free food.

Not the best location, next to a 7-Eleven. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-spud-san-francisco?select=sFjzFIWKmHn2sD9yoMfuag#YFcAathNcCPBS5PJS0uQYw But the space inside is clean and modern. The interior design seems like a 60's or 70's style - birchwood counter tables, curved shapes, and bright colors (white, orange and lime).

The staff is welcoming and efficient. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-spud-san-francisco?select=sFjzFIWKmHn2sD9yoMfuag#wD94ynH5JrnzV3bH2zzDng I got the steak spud ($8.95) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-spud-san-francisco?select=sFjzFIWKmHn2sD9yoMfuag#qRsHsFdPe4b9N1DDkyTAYQ topped with some veggies. It's the most popular menu item.

For a lighter meal, try the made to order salads. They're all vegetarian (some have cheese), and u can add meat for $1.50-$2.50 more (chicken, beef, sausage). I like the Thai crunch salad ($7.95). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-spud-san-francisco?select=sFjzFIWKmHn2sD9yoMfuag#Op9ECHaaGGzep-U19yHFXQ

The menu also includes: soup (cup $2.95, bowl $4.50) and desserts - sweet potato cheesecake, rice pudding and brownies. They also serve wine and beer.
author: Luis C.

description:
It's a good option for celiac people. Almost everything is gluten-free even the deserts.
The attendants are super gentle and the potatoes are delicious. 
We'll definitely come back!!!
author: Aline Naiane D.

description: Yuuuuuuummmmmm! Fast, delicious. The restaurant was super clean and the employees were kind. I had the wharf special and it was So good. The kids created their own foul potato combinations (olives, chicken, broccoli, sour cream, beans. What?) and they were content. Overall, a yummy way to warm up from the cold wharf wind.
author: Courtney B.

description: Hot Spud is a fun and casual shop which fills a restaurant niche I never knew I needed: delicious and highly decked-out baked potatoes. For such an off-the-wall place, Hot Spud was really clean and well-organized, with fresh ingredients and friendly staff. For SF, the prices aren't bad either and although I didn't get my 'spud' to go, service was fast enough that this would be a great choice to grab lunch or a snack with friends.
author: Eric M.

description: I basically paid ten dollars for a potato with a little bit of steak and mushrooms. Not worth lol
author: Robert L.

description: I've been here twice and each time, my potato was BOMB!!! My only complaint is random people coming in to ONLY use the bathroom. I know this may be tacky, but they should have a key so that only paying customers can use. Warning, this is very close to the pier, so pretty touristy.
author: Al Q.

description: Shocked at how good this was! Loved the selection of fresh veggies!
author: Jessica L.

description: It was pretty good! Something we can't get in la for sure :) couldn't finish half! So for the price, it's a big portion. It's a good experience when you're new to San Fran
author: Megumi T.

description:
I frickin' Love this place. Perfectly baked potatoes are hand crafted with fantastic fresh ingredients. I live on the other side of Nob Hill and make the trek over about once a week. Yum

If you are a picky eater, or have food allergies, or like to pretend you have food allergies, they will work with you to create a potato that is perfect for you.

I eat either the Chicken, Beef, or Sausage spud and don't customize it because their recipes are perfect. 

I really don't like peas but their peas taste like they were picked about an hour before I got there. They are delicious. All their ingredients are the best. 

Order your potato at the counter. You can stand at the glass divider and watch them make your potato or just go over to the self serve cooler and grab a drink, pop the cap, and take a seat while they make your food. They will call you when it is ready and you then go to the register and pay.

They have sparkling fruit sodas that are delicious plus a selection of beers and soft drinks.

If you are a local, let them know at the register and they will give you a discount. I wish they were on the Market Street side of town. They'd have lines out the door if they were in SOMA. It's worth a trip over to the Wharf. Take the F Market Trolley, the Cable Car from Powell, or just walk over on the gorgeous Embarcadero and treat yourself.
author: Kyle P.

description:
Came across this place and decided to give it a try even though I just ate. The concept alone was worth giving this place a try in my opinion...how can you say no to a place that specializes in baked potatoes?! 

The options are pretty crazy, and they have a wide selection of toppings to choose from. We got the sausage spud that came with sausage (of course), corn, olives, sour cream, stadium sauce (whatever that is), cheese, and butter. Didn't think it would be as good as it was, everything seemed to mesh well surprisingly.

I wouldn't drive all the way to the city just for this but I will definitely come back to try their other crazy combinations next time I'm in the area!
author: Kristin M.

description: The best baked potato or"jacket" potato I've ever had. It was the bomb.com. I had the custom xtra cheesy bacon shrimp broccoli with butter, sour cream and green onion potato. Off the charts! I could stuff my face with a hundred of these delicious tators. A must if you're at Fisherman's wharf. I definitely had a foodgasm.
author: Robin W.

description: Awesome!  We were walking at the wharf and my daughter who is vegan was hungry so I searched vegan options in the area and this place popped up. They were Very accommodating with my daughters vegan requests and there was something for all of us to eat! Delicious and fast.
author: Charmaine M.

description: We are visiting in town and came because they advertised gluten free menu items. If you love potatoes, you must come! The staff is friendly and the potatoes and salads excellent. I had the shrimp spud. The shrimp was excellent. I can't say enough good things!
author: Kathi C.

description: Fun concept. Like a subway but with potatoes! A little pricey but it's SF and in the tourist area so that would be expected.
author: Wildeflower M.

description:
Subway of baked potatoes. Long line, but that was to be expected during July 4th near Pier39.

I got the Wharf one, which came with crab, cheese, scallions, and a lemon sauce. Really good, but not as hearty as I wanted. Would probably get a chicken or steak-based option next time.
author: Codey O.

description: So I've walked past this place saying I'll try it and never did and boy did I miss out! I just got a veggie spud with Alfredo and it was delicious. If you enjoy loaded baked potatoes you gotta try it. I'll be trying out the steak or chicken one next time. They have a shrimp and crab one as well so great options. Check it out if your in the area, reasonably priced, great customer service and delicious :)
author: Meme K.

description: Just ok. Was really excited about the concept, but not super impressed with the execution. The place didn't seem particularly clean and the ingredients did not seem very fresh.
author: Jenny J.

description: Whether you are just visiting or are a local, if you don't go to this one of a kind restaurant while your here, it's seriously your loss. This place is unlike anything I've ever seen and it's delicious! The sweetest people work there and the food is quality. It's like a burrito bowl but potato. It's so yummy omg seriously my favorite thing in San Fransisco in all my 18 years of life
author: Courtney M.

description:
Delicious. We got a The Wharf Spud. Delicious.

We were concerned that it wasn't busy when we walked away in but now... That's a plus. No line and its amazing. I will visit again when I visit San Francisco. A little gem from the other busy restaurants in the area. 

Not expensive $10 a spud... And huge. You can share and still be full.

Stop by and taste it for yourself.
author: Diana F.

description:
Good wholesome food, just what the family needed after a few days of rich,  sweet dining. 

Really enjoyed a change from the usual fare at Fisherman's wharf.
author: Geof R.

description: Great fast food and it is gluten free which is a big plus for me.
author: Ellen M.

description: I consider myself to be a potato head, it was only right that i would fall in love with a potato haven such as Hot Spud. I usually get the chicken or shrimp spud, both are to die for. I love the chipotle tartar sauce and could eat that shit on anything. I highly recommend this hot spot!
author: Tinai J.

description: We walked here because it got 4.5 stars and my daughter loves baked potatoes. I got the crab spud. It was okay. We also ordered the steak spud, which was better. Friendly atmosphere.
author: Rica A.

description: Everything I've had here is awesome. Take the fun experience of fast-food, but make the food itself more delicious, healthy, and satisfying, and you've got Hot Spud.
author: Webb P.

description: A little pricey but still good, I go here a few times a week because I work near it.  Definitely worth a try if you like potatoes.  Go with the chicken or steak spud!!
author: Aaron P.

description: I met my sister here for lunch since she works at Fisherman's wharf and has evolved past clam chowder in a bread bowl. This place seems to be frequented by area employees and the occasional wayward tourist. The location is tucked away from the main thoroughfare so it's not as packed as other spots and you can easily get in and out in time to catch a bus tour or scheduled activity. As far as the food, It's a simple concept that works perfectly: Pick your spud, throw on some culinary accessories and dive-in. There are salad options but they specialize in baked potatoes which come with cheese, sc, butter and onions. Go crazy with the topping add-ons at a reasonable cost or pick one or their creations. My potato  was cooked perfectly and I went with the veggie, zero regrets. My sister swears by the shrimp chipotle spud which was tasty but definitely has a kick. My meal was less than $10 with plenty of leftovers for another go around. Highly recommended.
author: Kat T.

description: Great and fun option! The baked potatoes and salads are delicious! The restaurant employees are very clean and change their gloves without us asking (I am vegetarian) out of 11 people they only made 1 small error. They kept all the potatoes organized so we could easily tell who's was who's. Also, they have a large variety of vegetables. The line was short and our order took about 6 minutes. Just be wary- he potatoes are pretty filling and pretty large. (About the size of your foot)
author: Swati D.

description: My sis and I were trying to get a good and reasonably priced ($10 or below) place to have lunch, and we were sick of subway. We chance upon this place and ended up loving it a lot!
author: Ting H.

description: I bought a spud to take out to eat in my hotel room. The service was extremely accomadating. Very friendly.  They let me create my own combination with no issues.  And OMG...that spud was slammin'. The Veggie comb, added chicken and sour cream. DELICIOUS!  An easy and great solution to hunger if you don't want tourist trap food or expensive dining.
author: Jomarie B.

description: Loved this place!!! I love anything potato!!! But this was a great concept! Customize your own potato!!! The potatoes are huge, they are extremely hefty with the toppings, and they taste incredible!!! We went here repeatedly during our stay and I truly wish there was a hot spud in CT!! Friendly staff and really good price!!!
author: Morgan W.

description:
I am not a baked potato fan, but when I saw Genevieve Y's and Wilhelm Y's review and photos for Hot Spud on the same day, I was sold and decided to go the next day after work.

Parking was easy to find but I think we just got lucky and found a spot right in front.  Bf got the steak spud and I got the wharf to go.  It took less than 10 minutes for both potatoes to be ready.  We were also given samples of their brownie.  The staff was very eager to please.

Yum, I LOVED my potato!!  It was HUGE and I was only able to eat about a third of it.  There was a good amount of crab meat and I loved the cheesy, buttery, and salty goodness.. soo good.  I also loved, loved, LOVED the green and red onion.  BF loved his steak potato but beef isn't really my thing.

I didn't like the brownie.  I thought they tasted like bananas, but bf mentioned that they were supposed to be sweet potato brownies.  I took one bite and that was enough.

-1 star.. it's kinda pricey for a potato.
author: Vivian H.

description: Baked potato (large) with toppings is the theme. I stayed away from the sauces, seemed like overkill.  Small seating area.
author: Mike M.

description: If you love jacket potatoes ... this is the place ! You can either choose or customise it with veggies and dressing :) loved it!
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Add on is 2 for $0.65 each my love and I added avo & mushrooms which are not a bad deal!

Great customer service!

Yummy hot spud!

Love the atmosphere and the workers, super chill and helpful!

Will always return! Thanks you guys!!
author: Shells M.

description:
We were looking for a good yet cheap way to end our first night in San Francisco when I came across this place on yelp. 

SERVICE: The servers were nice and helpful while taking our orders and assisting us. 

AMBIANCE: Underwhelming but in a good way. Besides, I would really rather have an underwhelming ambiance than underwhelming food, which brings us to...

FOOD: We ordered Steak Spuds, the sweet potato brownie, rice pudding, Mixed fruit salad (??) and shrimp spud. Everything was delicious! I mean, personally, I didn't like the rice pudding but my sisters adored it and finished all two servings. The salad may have been a little bit too overdressed as well but it was still good.

I'll try a spud restaurant here in LA and see if I like it as much. After all, I can't go to SF just for spuds. Or can I?
author: Lee P.

description: This is the best place to eat in the Wharf.It is a giant patatoe and awesome fresh toppings in it.Their price is really good for that food and the customer is very friendly.
author: İsmail Cem E.

description:
Service with a smile. This shop has old fashioned service.  Great attitudes and terrific food. One day I'll venture beyond the signature veggie spud with Alfredo sauce.  But don't see that happening anytime soon. 

You pick your beverage from a wall of fridges just beyond register.  Desserts are good, especially the mini cheesecakes. Just be sure they're not at room temperature and come from the fridge locker.
author: Karl S.

description:
We went on a Sat afternoon and the restaurant was not busy during lunch.

We had a shrimp, a steak and a crab baked potato.  It is definitely not fancy food but the food was delicious.  The workers were friendly.  It's a good place to grab a fast bit in the area.
author: Mike Y.

description: Hot potato goodness!! Delicious toppings and awesome filling meal
author: Roxanne R.

description:
Wow - major star inflation.  Perhaps a lot of tourists come here and give it high ratings but I have lived in SF for 11+ years and I am super picky. 

I work in the area and got a salad to go the other day.  The service was very efficient and friendly but the food was terrible.  I got a chicken ceasar, thinking that it was a pretty sure bet.  The salad was terribly overdressed, the lettuce wilted, the croutons yuck, there was barely any chicken and just all around NOT tasty.

I would not go back, though their potatoes appear to be good.
author: Jen K.

description: I had the pleasure of stopping by to get a meal here recommend by a good friend of mine. I truly did enjoy the shrimp one. It was delicious and I would definitely visit here again when I'm in the are. Staff is friendly too
author: Mirlena Z.

description: Nice concept. Service was strained ... Warm potato with cold fillings made me rate lower ... Great concept though
author: Jonelle L.

description:
This place is perfect. I know sf has a lot of good options, but this place is unique and down right delicious. I'm sad to leave sf only eating here once. I'm a very adventurous Easter but my travel companion is extremely picky but this place more than satisfied both of us. 

DO IT!
author: Chloe G.

description: So we decided to go with spuds over sandwiches. Yummy!!!! The Wharf was delicious and the crab was fresh. They welcomed substitutions. The salad was fresh and lite. They have one of the best restaurant brownies I've ever had. It was a bit pricey, but for fresh great tasting food with unique flavored, it was the right choice for us.
author: Teri J.

description: A great place for something quick and good. The shrimp potato is amazing. The simple baked potato is my favorite tho. Great meal for the price. Sweet potato cheesecake is a yummy treat too. The staff is happy and friendly. Love it!
author: Brandi R.

description: Really good food, both tasty and high quality. Service is friendly & efficient. I came here as part of a Girl Scout trip - the staff was courteous to  and patient with all 6 of our 5th grade girls. All 8 of our orders came out quickly and as ordered. I wish I lived closer so I could come back!
author: Mrs. M.

description:
Wow!  This place is really the bomb.  I had to do a little convincing with the wife and kid in order to get them excited about a baked potato lunch.
