Money was getting tight and we were at the tail end of our 1 week vacation.  I saw the positive reviews of my fellow yelpers and thought it was worth a try.

First off the owners/managers take great pride in the cleanliness and customer service.  The place was spotless and they make everything to order.  No problems with substitutions, additions, etc.  I went with a steak potato, while my wife and son built chicken spuds.  Large selection of toppings here, almost reminds me of a frozen yogurt  bar.  The potato skin is soaked in olive oil and seasoned masterfully.  

There should be one of these in every strip mall in LA and the OC.  This is a really great place and amazingly affordable.  The 3 of us ate until stuffed for $25 in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Scott A.

description: Always tasty! Something different, gluten free friendly and quick service! Food is always fresh!
author: Nicole S.

description:
crew was nice and friendly..place was clean and serves Ice cold beer..the chicken spud was so so delicious! will most definitely be coming back soon..
thanks you guys for cheering up my girl after she was acting hangry!
author: Henry M.

description:
Okay, it was a effing potato.  Was it good?  Sure, but it was a potato....

So, if you're in the mood for a potato, then, hey, you're in luck, because this place has them.

I thought the food was good, I got the sausage potato, it had sausage, some veggies, some sour cream and sauce.  I was tasty, but I don't know if I felt like it was a real meal.  Maybe it's the lack of carbs, but that's probably not a bad thing, maybe it was the lack of a real amount of protein.  I think maybe that's it, for the price, the protein is under represented.

I'd offer the following suggestion, a way to eat the skin afterwards, like if you got a big side of butter (real butter) and sour cream and maybe some cheese.  And an open grill to melt and heat, now that I could go for.

A baked potato, and then when you are done, you get a potato skin appetizer, that would be backwards, but it would beat just throwing the skin away.  Or worse, eating it plain.

Anyway, I'm not bagging on the place, it was good, but that's about it, good.
author: Michael B.

description:
This place was literally right across the street from our hotel. We decided to check it out because a.) it was convenient and b.) it had good reviews on Yelp.  

So after taking a stroll in the city we went, and were immediately greeted by the workers. This is basically a Chipotle-style place with potatoes. You can basically get a custom made spud, with all sorts of yummy toppings. I got mine with steak, corn and cheese, and some other things that I can't quite remember. 

Either way, it was very good and healthy compared to other options we had. The price was definitely  reasonable! 

Worth checking out if you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Jessica C.

description: Good variety of product.  Deceptively filling.  Nice crew.
author: Loren H.

description:
This is a nice change of pace.  I love baked potatoes, and having the ability to load it up as I want is even better.  The food is very affordable and I walked away full.

There are plenty of choices.  I added beef, corn, feta and hot sauce.  They automatically mix in a little butter and cheese when they prepare the potato.  They chop up the insides almost like mashed potatoes.

They do have options other than potatoes.
author: Brandon S.

description: Great place, tried their chicken spud, was very filling and totally enjoyed it, most recommended for those who wanna try something new!
author: Jashan S.

description: Great food, good variety. I suggest you decline sour cream on your "spud."  The rest of the toppings are flavorful and there is already sauce. The sour cream they offered (and I accepted) only diluted the great taste. They have perfected the baked potato.
author: Matt W.

description:
I love it. Who doesn't love potatoes? You'd seriously have to be a monster to hate on a good old fashioned baked potato.

There are always two dudes behind the counter and they're the friendliest people. Service is just excellent. They're speedy and efficient. You couldn't ask for more.

Inside it's extremely clean. In fact, the set up reminds me a lot of Chipotle, only better lit. 

As for the baked potatoes themselves, the only thing I dislike is that they, by default, come with an insane amount of sour cream. I'm fairly confident you can ask them to reduce it while they make it (Chipotle style) though and I'll probably do that next time I'm there (which I definitely will be).

Other than that, they're well baked with generous portions on the side. The price may seem a bit up there for a baked potato but don't be fooled. These are definitely a full meal. 

I want to see Hot Spud go nationwide because I fucking love potatoes and I really, really like this place. 

The only thing stopping it from being 5 stars? More potato options. I want to see more than just salads and baked potatoes. 

Go HAM with those potatoes. You can create SO MUCH with a good fucking potato and I want to see them do that. 

Otherwise, if you love potatoes like I do, make the trek over to Hot Spud. It's worth it.
author: Jaehak Y.

description:
I just got a steak spud here. So tasty and fresh food. You can customize it at your preferences. Staff is very welcoming. I greatly recommend it if you are around. Clean and healthy. Much better than all tourists focused places here. 
I will definitely come back.
author: Serge P.

description:
Got the steak spud. I replaced the peas with bacon, which turned out to be a great combination. The amount of toppings was appropriate for the amount of potato. It was a good portioned meal and very flavorful. The steak was well marinated and cooked perfectly, tender and pink on the inside. Only thing I think they could improve on is making the potato skin crispier, which would make it into the perfect hot potato. This is a unique concept for a restaurant and a joy to experience. Reminded me of chipotle in the sense that it was a casual but savory meal.

Also got the sweet potato brownie, which was especially delicious for a gluten free dessert. Very rich and moist and dense, shared it with another person and we could barely finish it.

Great service, restaurant is casual and clean. A bit on the pricier side but it is practically in Fisherman 's Wharf. Overall would definitely come back.
author: Justin T.

description:
So, I chose to try this place out because of the great reviews. I love potatoes and shrimp, so I thought I'd put those two together in the a potato.  It was good and filling. 

The chairs on the other hand are really loud and annoying when you move them around the restaurant. The place also needed a good cleaning. Food on the ground and disgusting bathroom.
author: April S.

description: Our Thai salads with chicken was gross.  This place seems very touristy.  Even though the concept is neat, we were just not feeling this place but I can't say you should not try it for yourself.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
This is a great little restaurant that was conveniently located across the street from our hotel! My family and I ate here after arriving in San Francisco and checking in, so we were pretty hungry! 

I got the Shrimp Spud with Chipotle Tartar Sauce and it was woo good! I stepped away for a bit while my hot potato was being made; and when I got back, my food was waiting for me (picked up by my sister or cousin)! They told me that there was supposed to be 5 shrimp on my spud,); but they only had 4, so he reimbursed me 75¢! Super cool!

The guy working there (I believe he's the owner), was really nice and friendly and the place is nicely decorated!
author: Faye M.

description: Yep .  Five stars.  Great service for starters followed by really good food.  I love this idea and the owner said that due to demand he is adding sweet potatoes to the line up soon.
author: Jake R.

description: Perfect  indulgence for me I crave hot spud all the time best place I been to in a long time
author: Nicole A.

description: Amazing, beautiful, sexy baked potato stuffed with cheese and veggies $8. It reminded me of traveling in Istanbul and baked potato bars on every corner. Hot Spud is very celiac disease-friendly with many gluten-free options including desserts! It is not worthy of a special out of the way trip if you are not nearby or not gluten intolerant. If you are local be sure to tell them, it is an extra 10% off your order (tourist tax). This is a perfect wintertime food (it is not very healthy but it's OK)!
author: Shannon Z.

description: This place is so good! Even before I finished my hot potato, I wanted another one. The potato is really more like mashed potato than a baked potato - it's so soft and cheesy. Be careful - you'll start craving this place.
author: Theresa M.

description:
Well, they've got a neat idea going on here: take a baked potato, throw on some standard toppings, and then add a few extra unique specialty items. And voila, you get a specialty baked potato! I can't believe that no one else has tried this yet, so, why haven't I heard about it before?

Sadly, it sounds better in theory than it does when executed. That's not to say the food is bad, oh no. In fact, it's not bad at all, but, the steak potato was certainly not something that wowed me, or left me with the distinct impression that I'd ever crave it and come out here for it.

But, if you're in the area, are hungry, and like yourself some fancy potatoes, $7-8 will land you a huge, reasonably tasty dish. We actually shared it between three people, but that's because we had made prior food stops, and had a few more to make after this. Still, I imagine one potato can easily make for two meals for one, so there's good value to be had here.
author: Johnny W.

description: Um. Wow! This place is amazing. I don't think I've ever enjoyed a potato this much. We had the chicken  (minus the hot sauce) and the sausage.  Both were spectacular!  If you are in the area- a must try! Live that it's gluten free also. I asked what a sauce was like and they showed me the recipe.  Pretty cool place. 5 stars all the way.  Great food, great service.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
4.5 Star average? For a glorified baked potato? Really? 

I was hanging out in the city with some friends when we decided to have an early dinner (everyone was starving). They wanted to try out Hot Spud. "Sure" I said as we headed in the direction of pier 39. I should have said "how about 'no.'"

So I like the concept of Hot Spud. Someone cooks a rather large potato, splits it open lengthwise, adds cheese, veggies, meat, and some type of sauce. A gourmet baked potato. Sounds good, right? So then why was this place such a disappointment? I ordered their chicken spud (chicken, bacon, corn, olives, green onions, and sour cream) and I thought that the potato itself wasn't that great and the chicken was way overcooked. Much too dry. I expect much more from an establishment with 4.5 stars.

In short: Food is "meh," price is okay, this restaurant is just okay. I probably will not be back considering that there are plenty of dining options in the area.
author: John B.

description:
I want to make a point of saying that I AM a San Francisco local. I've of course had better food in the city. However- I gave this place 5 stars and Ill tell you why.

I was recently diagnosed with Celiac Disease and have gotten sick at several places in SF with awesome food claiming to be gluten free. Shame on me for not explaining that I am not Paleo by choice as many gf people in SF are but I have an actual allergic reaction to gluten. 

The staff was accommodating and knew exactly what my condition meant as far as contamination. They changed gloves and explained that only a few salad toppings had gluten like their wonton strips. My husband and I were at America's cup and heading to North Beach for a Comedy Show afterwards and needed a quick bite to eat. I saw that they were Gluten Free friendly on yelp and checked them out! 

We both were really happy with the chicken spud. Nice, warm and filling potato for a cold day on the pier. We split one and that was plenty. I don't care if it may be a tourist spot. I just think a real gluten free, celiac friendly place with good food deserves an awesome review. It's not a bistro or even a nice sit down place, it's a sort of fast food/cafe for a quick bite. 

I didn't get sick either and felt awesome! Great experience and am planning on going back! Awesome idea for a food joint!
author: Cassie B.

description: Enormous baked potatoes. Gluten free everything! They had sweet potato cheesecake and sweet potato brownie, both gluten free. For a celiac, that is a dream come true. Absolutely delicious, and the price is reasonable. I have to go here next time I'm in the city.
author: Kim D.

description:
Let me start by saying I am a huge baked potato fan.... When I saw this place was just below the hotel I was staying, well I was glad that a least something went right with the hotel experience (See my other reviews for that experience). 

Ordered the steak potato and it was exactly what I was hoping for. Steak was cooked perfectly and the rest of the toppings were a perfect complement. 

The guys behind the counter were extremely friendly and the place was clean.

Without question, I will be returning this trip and every future trip.
author: Eric L.

description:
What a cool little place!

Perfect for a smaller meal after a flight, or lunch. 

Definitely will return.
author: Eric D.

description: Their potatoes are huge and honestly worth it's price. I wouldn't suggest getting your own if you just want a snack. The combinations a pretty weird but they work well together. I got the steak spud and I was just  couldn't really finish it by myself though.
author: Nikki D.

description: I'm upgrading one star based on consistency, flavor, and all-around niceness. Took in daughter for the first time yesterday....she ordered a simple potato with traditional fixin's and gobbled it right up. I ordered the Wharf again....yep, total rut....and again loved it. And they are so incredibly friendly there. Why can't you open one in uptown/downtown Oakland? I'm telling you, the lunch business would be out the door! Yum-a-licious.
author: Laurie H.

description: I was really excited about working in the warf and having my usual potato fix, but today was a less than stellar experience. Usually when I come here it's quick fast friendly service but today it seemed a little quite than usual. The menu has so many options so making a decision can be tuff. The Oder taker which was a African man was very rude while taking my order, I asked for a basic spud with cheese, sour cream green onion bacon butter and shrimp. I asked for extra cheese also but I guess he did not listen for that modification he just pointed to the items I had mentioned and asked do I want this also. So finally I get  my order the cook attempts to ring me up a 2nd time and I'm thinking why don't you guys communicate or specify that this order is paid. I really didn't feel welcomed this final visit. I also asked for the manager and nobody knew when he came in, so I just told them I will not return and I'm also going to tell everyone else that works with me about this experience. I won't even recommend this place anymore to none of my customers that are interested in a quick bite thank you for taking my money and not giving a shit about me.
author: Adrian C.

description:
It's time to profess my LOVE of the Hot Spud. I've been a loyal customer from the day they first opened their doors. I've probably consumed about 200 spuds since then. I'm an addict. They are my spud dealer. I've managed to cut my spud consumption down to about one a week, but the temptation is always there. I never thought I could love potatoes as much as I do. These are NOT your ordinary baked potatoes though.... 

My favorite spud is the shrimp spud. It has Cheese, butter olives, corn, and onions. I add warm sautéed Mushrooms. It is topped with perfectly grilled shrimp. The key ingredient is the Chipotle sauce. I've tried to make this sauce at home and I just can't. It's the most creamy blend of deliciousness. There is a mixture of spicy, little sweet and a dash of lemon. I've reached the point where I request an extra cup on the side. I scrape that spud clean and basically drink the remaining sauce. Like I've said, I am an addict.  

I also like the ambiance. It's perfect for eating alone or eating with a group. The music playing is always a good beat and the colors are cheerful. The staff is awesome. I just feel good going there and it's an overall great experience. 

So if you're wondering whether or not you should check out Hot Spud, I urge you to do so. Just not between 11:30 and 12:00 on the weekdays because that's when I get my fix and I don't want to wait on a long line. ;) ENJOY!

P.S. You get a discount as a local.
author: Daisy F.

description:
My boyfriend and I totally came here just to use the bathroom since the area is touristy and public restrooms are not readily available, and felt obligated to buy something out of courtesy. We lucked out with Hot Spud! God knows I love a baked potato, and this place is my heaven. We shared a Chicken baked potato, filled with the usual sour cream, butter, cheese, scallions but it also had delicious chicken, olives, and bacon.

 I wish I had one of these closer to home. I know I could easily make it myself but it tastes so much better when somebody else does it for you. Anyway, they also serve beer which I didn't know until after we had payed.
author: Alison M.

description: Great food and convenient location near pier 39 and fishermans wharf parking. I always take the time to eat here every time I end up visiting San Francisco
author: Matthew P.

description:
Surprised I haven't reviewed before.  Not in my immediate neighborhood, so I only go occasionally.  The potatoes are large and flavorful and well cooked.  The toppings are generously portioned.

The staff is super friendly and often gives me the 10% neighborhood discount.  They typically are cool about substituting like for like, and if they recognize you might comp some crunches or extra sauce.  A good karma place, I'm smiling as I type this
author: Steve S.

description:
Best. baked. potatoes. ever!

I love potatoes, and have had many baked potatoes. Hot Spud definitely tops the list! If you happen to be in the Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 area, you should definitely check this place out! The customer service is amazing, the employees are friendly, and the food is absolutely delicious. I came here with my boyfriend on a weekday at around 4pm. It wasn't packed, but there were people dining which made it a little difficult to find a seat. 

First off, there are SO many options to choose from, so you will definitely not be disappointed. I opted to make my own potatoes with bacon, cheese, sour cream, chives, corn and a side of alfredo sauce. My boyfriend got the cheese, steak, and sour cream potato with a side of chipotle sauce. The lady who took our orders was super sweet and she even suggested what sauces we should get with our potatoes since all of them were made in house. The wait time was about 10 minutes for a potatoes which wasn't bad.

The potato was baked to perfection! Earlier, I saw one of the employees mashing/mixing the potato which I found odd, but I soon realized that he was mixing the cheese into the potato instead of piling it on. The bacon wasn't the best since it was pre made, but it was alright. The alfredo sauce, which I HIGHLY recommend, really took the potato to another level! So perfectly creamy, mm! My boyfriend's steak was so juicy! I found myself scraping the sides of the potato to get the leftovers.. something I rarely do lol.

Love this place! Remember, get the alfredo sauce and the steak!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Service was very good, they answered all the questions to make a good decision. 
Spuds are very tasty. The place is very good, clean and with good music.
author: Mari C.

description:
**** 4 stars ****
I found this place on yelp yesterday since i want to have a great last day of 2011! Therefore, I went there today!:) The male staff is pretty nice to me and my friend!
And i got a steak spud is so delicious and i am full when i was done! Even though i went there at 1pm and didn't eat any food! But my friend got a sausage spud is soso, i think it's too sour for me. Overall this is a great area to have a lunch!
author: Kassidi L.

description:
TOURISTS BEWARE: Hot Spud is in no way representative of the quality or type of food in San Francisco.  In general, Hot Spud has a nice concept that's not there yet - if they can retool their recipes a bit, they could be churning out some seriously good-enough-to-create-a-line-on-weds-night comfort food.  

While some of the toppings are good, you quickly work your way down to a potato with nothing but a huge dollop of butter - basically an unflavored starch-and-fat overload.  It's kind of like eating a cupcake with good frosting but flavorless but fattening cake

I think tweaking the recipe of their "naked" potato to have some basics (e.g. Ikes's "dirty sauce" or In N Out's "animal style" sauce) would help a lot.  The same is true for the veggies which steamed and flavorless - sauteing the veggies and/or adding some seasoning/sauce would make it a much better meal overall.  We all like frosting but it would be nice to eat the whole cupcake.  

On a positive note, I did like the shrimps, basically a quick saute with salt/pepper garlic - unfortunately they count out exactly 5 smallish shrimp per potato, so the party ends pretty quick.  

All in all a star for a nice concept and another for friendly staff but minus three for the food - especially since this is likely forming many tourist's impressions of food in SF.  Sigh...
author: Rosers M.

description: Thank heavens for this place cause I could never satisfy my baked potato food craving in SF unless I happened to go to a steakhouse. So awesome in every way from the menu offerings, to the staff, to the location. I've started to make it a lunchtime habit here on my days off - hopping on the Muni 47 inbound, and afterwards I take a walk through Pier 39 down to the Ferry Bldg. Love the friendliness of the staff - they offered me a discount on my last visit even though I didn't work around the area. My fave spud is the veggie which I add shrimp, jalapeno, and chipotle tartar sauce to. Definitely try their sweet potato dessert offerings too - the brownies are the bomb - Mmmmmm delicious!
author: Elaine W.

description: I had the chicken spud, it was very good and filling. I'm a big fan of the buffalo sauce
author: Bryan C.

description:
I enjoyed the food here! Came here last week after taking the Ride the Duck tour with my boyfriend and it was delicious.
It was walking distance from both Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 (right in between). We walked in and there was a short line. There were the right amount of options on the menu including a build your own spud which includes 4 vegetable toppings. We paid then sat down. I really liked how the place looked as well. It was simple but the colorful wall made it look complete.
Lemme just say that the Chipotle Tartar was bomb diggity. The potato was baked nicely and man, everything about it was so good. They also have a mini table of condiments, napkins, and water for the customers.
The people working were pretty kind but seemed to be a little bored hahaha.
All in all, my boyfriend and I enjoyed our food and experience at Hot Spud. We plan to go back soon to try more from their menu. If all is well during my second time here, I will gladly change my review to the full five stars!
author: Shannon C.

description: On my lazy day off I don't like to even get dressed, so I always order delivery. Its mostly pizza, cheesesteaks, or Chinese, and I always feel guilty after eating it. So today I decided to search for a healthier option and I am SO glad I did. The fruit and nut salad was perfect and I couldn't pass up the wharf spud, which was truly amazing. Delivery was fast and I'll definitely be ordering again soon.
author: Liana C.

description: Cool concept, but tastes like your average baked potato. I didn't put any sauce, butter, or cheese on mine, which is probably why it tasted so plain. The chicken was a little bland and not very tender, but the potato was huge.
author: Thea S.

description: The food is good here, but just yesterday I received food poisoning from the salad. I feel like I'm dying.. I am never eating here again.
author: Mark Q.

description: I have been coming here for 3 years! I love getting lunch here when im on my lunch break. I love the staff. They do there best to remember my name ha! They all pretty much remember my usual. Steak Spud, Extra Alfredo, Sour Cream, with Bacon. Same for 3 years. Staff are really chill, the owner is very polite and takes ALOT of pride in his  establishment. For $10 you get a full meal and I have no problem paying $10 for a stuffed stomach.
author: Kyle R.

description: Great food. Jacket potato at its best. You can dress it up with your toppings. Yummmm. I wouldn't get the salads though.  It was basically ice berg lettuce with bits of other stuff. The spud was delicious though.
author: Prachi P.

description: Very good food for the price. No waiting and a friendly staff. We'll probably return again during this visit to Fishermans wharf.
author: Jim F.

description: My potato was overcooked so the bottom quarter and the outside was leathery and thick.  The rest of it was fluffy and very tasty and perhaps the potato isn't the point once you fill it with toppings but still I expected to be able to eat the spud.
author: Megan B.

description:
Came here tonight and got the fiesta salad. It's a typical mexican inspired salad that consists of lettuce, black beans, corns, tomatoes, and tortilla chips. It's not bad, but honestly nothing too special either.

Service is friendly, but waaay TOO SLOW. I waited 15 minutes since the family in front of me take forever to order since the employee took the order very slowly. Even after he took my order, he talked to the lady behind me and ended up taking her order at the same time. This is time in most places, but it seems that every spuds order comes with 10 additional questions, so this slows my order even more.

It's a cute place to eat in the Wharf, but way too slow for my liking.
author: Novalina N.

description: Delicious meal worth repeating.  Friendly bohemian wait staff.  Freshly prepared original menu offerings.  Had chicken spud, shrimp spud and crab spud.  All were enjoyed and all of my family had a clean plate, even my 11 year old daughter.  Great variety of local beverages.
author: Mona M.

description: ITS TATOES BUT AMAZING!!!!   I love their chicken potato combination that they have on the menu.  Its a great mix of spicy and creamy awesomeness
author: Andrew C.

description:
It's Hot Spudded check it and see,
Internal temperature over 103!
Don't worry baby, it's all gluten free.
Hot Spudded, Hot Spudded!

You don't have to read my mind
To know I want that shrimp chipotle done right
Honey you oughta know
Sauces and dressing here are made from scratch
Using local ingredients you just can't match
I wanna know, what's taking so long to get here from the wharf! 

Now it's up to you, we can eat on a secret redezvous
Just me and you, I'll show you spuddin' like you never knew.

That's why it's Hot Spudded check it and see,
Internal temperature over 103!
Don't worry baby, it's all gluten free.
Hot Spudded, Hot Spudded!
author: Kevin C.

description:
Oh please, it's a decent-sized baked potato to which you can go with one of their combinations, or tell them what you want to pile on. An overall rating of 4.5 stars for this place sets the wrong expectation.

I chose the one that comes with crab.  I'd say the crab applied was skimpy, but fresh and tasty.  The scoop of sour cream on top was so cold that it turned the hot, steamy potato fixins into a coolish emulsion when I mixed it in.

Left with a full tummy, and certainly my potato craving has been sated for a while.
author: Lxs S.

description: Very nice idea for people who eat only gluten free food. A jacked potato (instead of a sandwich) filled with crab, shrimps, meat or vegetables. Highly recommended for a cheap and fast lunch.
author: Giulia D.

description: Great selection of potato toppings. You can get just about anything you want. This place is a couple of blocks away from the wharf, but it is worth the walk. When the the food was great, what really impressed me was the level of service the staff gave to everyone that came in, whether they were paying customers or not. A very old Asian lady came in and sat down at a table next to the front door. One of the guys brought her a glass of water and talked to her as she sat there. I saw her the next day at the pier and it appeared that the lady was homeless. The kindness that the staff showed is rare.
author: Bill G.

description: Good salads. The place doesn't look as put together as I originally thought it would. But that's no biggy. There isn't much variety to the menu. Just salads and potatoes.
author: Rachael D.

description: They will customize any menu item to meet your special dietary restrictions. Then they'll add extra of the stuff you can have. What a great customer service touch.
author: Brian F.

description: Right when we walked in and looked at the menu, the guy behind the counter assured us that he can alter any order according to how we want it. He gave us some time to figure out what we wanted and helped us as soon as we were ready. I ordered a create your own and when I said shrimp, the guy told me that it would take about 7 minutes because they grill to order. It was delicious and tasted really fresh. The service was quick and great. The guy was also very friendly.
author: Lora P.

description: Never had a potato meal before, but really enjoyed the steak mix. Was served nice and hot.
author: Kay T.

description:
Great catering services! Cemil was very helpful in setting up a menu for my team. It ended up being way too much food, but that's ok because it was also cheap. We will definitely order from them again!

They also get extra love from me for being so gluten-free friendly. Go hot spud!
author: Natalie P.

description:
Amazing! Not only do I love it.. but it has a my fiancé's (he's a jacket potato loving Brit) approval.

The cheese infused with the scooped out mashed potato and then placed back into the skin is the best part.. definitely adds a lot of flavor in every bite. I've only tried the chicken and veggie spuds.. looking forward to trying the crab and shrimp options. Try the hot wing or chipotle sauce with your spud.. it doesn't disappoint.

Just wish they weren't located in Fisherman's Wharf. It isn't the trek over there that I mind, it is the tourist overload that is overwhelming when I get there.
author: Seema M.

description:
This place was my first meal in California. I really didn't want a potato, so I was glad when there were other options. My travel buddy had herself a lovely shrimp potato and she could not stop raving about it. 

I had a Thai Crunch salad and it was fantastic. All sorts of delicious tastes and the like. the gave me dressing when I asked for it with no glare or resentment to be seen (you'd be surprised how rude some Boston counter-people can be)! Yay!

My one reservation was that with all of the fresh foods, the tangerine slices were clearly from a can. No less delicious, but it didn't really fit the scope of fresh everything. I adored, somehow, the counter girl scrubbing actual potatoes in the sink. That's a big thumbs up.
author: Cronut C.

description: This has been the friendliest place I have been. The food is absolutely amazing and they accommodate to any food choices you ask for. After me and my friends first potato, we asked if we could get a half a potato. Though they normally don't do it they were happy to do it for us. I definitely recommend anyone here that wants a delicious, filling and affordable meal.
author: Shan L.

description:
Was on a foodie mission in the city and after stuffing our faces with food from the Ferry Building and clam chowder bread bowls at the wharf we were on the way back to the car when we saw Hot Spud. 

I didnt think there was any room left in our bellies but after seeing the concept and consulting Yelp we decided to share one! We ended up with the shrimp potato with the chipotle sauce. This was probably the best baked potato I have ever had, I was mad I had to split it with my friends. 

Nevermind the bread bowls, next time Im in SF its all about the spud. Now if only there was one in LA :)
author: jeff l.

description: Ever feel in the mood for a potatoe? This is the place to go. It was walking distance from our hotel, and a quick bite before our tourist adventures. They have every kind of potato you can imagine, plus nice salads. I got the steak potato which was delicious. My husband got the Mexican salad which he enjoyed. It wasn't a long wait, and not crowded at 11:00 when they first open.
author: Kristen F.

description: The manager was extremely rude. I asked for a couple of napkins before I ordered and the manager completely blew up and said the napkins were only for customers. Unfortunately I didn't stay long enough to find out if the food was good. Poor management will not earn you my business. Too bad for him.
author: Rajeshni N.

description: This place is more like a fast food restaurant and thus different than I expected. However, the food was great and the price reasonable which is hard to find around the wharf. We would definitely come back.
author: Jürgen H.

description:
Wow! Really surprised at how good it was here. 

A nice treat and would love to see one closer to home!

When we got home we tried so hard to recreate one of the spuds we tried, no match to the real thing!
author: Erin N.

description: Almost the whole place is gluten free!! Very fresh and very fast! Delicious giant potatoes!
author: Kelly T.

description:
I can't remember the last time I said "no" to a potato.

When I saw Hot Spud on Yelp, I immediately told my coworkers that I was going there Friday after work, whether it be alone or with them.  So, coworker K and I headed there after work around 6:30 PM.

There were no other people in the shop for some odd reason.  We expected there to be tons of tourists, but even walking along Beach was fairly empty.  So, we both ordered: the chicken spud for her (buffalo wing sauce, chicken, corn, olives) and the Wharf spud for me (crab, a butter sauce, corn, and peppers).

Oh. My. God.  I also can't remember the time I had a bad potato, and this was the epitome of YUM STATUS.  Cold crab meat, warm potato innards mashed with butter and salt, creamy butter sauce, corn kibbles.. I can't think of anything better on a cold night when you're starving.

The staff was super sweet; they came by and gave us a free piece of their sweet potato brownie, and for someone who dislikes brownies and anything too chocolatey, I sort of devoured the whole thing because it tasted unique.  And it tasted very delicious.

The best part of the night was when they asked us where we worked in the city, and we were just so excited that they didn't take us as tourists.  AWESOME.

Starch, I heart you.  Always and forever.
author: Tori S.

description:
4.5 stars!!

I love this place!  For me a good baked potato is something that is comforting to eat and makes me feel right at home.  The big, fully loaded baked potato I had last night at Hot Spud was delicious and filling.  I ordered the Steak Spud (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/JcyoZPdWdhlsrIVEMdLQ2A?select=sFjzFIWKmHn2sD9yoMfuag) which consisted of grilled steak, alfredo sauce, sauteed mushrooms, black olives, peas, corn and green onion.  They started with a big baked Russet, scored it and broke up the inside of the potato with a small metal spatula.  The alfredo sauce was actually created within the hot potato by adding a little salt, some butter then a mound of freshly grated cheese that was carefully mixed into the entire potato using just the spatula.  The hot potato meat cooked the raw ingredients into a nice thickened sauce.  The other ingredients, all pre-cooked, were piled on top and spread throughout.  My potato preparer even threw in a little bit of sour cream.

I ordered my potato with a cup of the daily soup.  For Monday the soup was Shrimp Vegetable (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/JcyoZPdWdhlsrIVEMdLQ2A?select=fyigjwFwcbsTuvV9wy7-cQ).  They have a refrigerator unit full of cold beverages.  Everything from juice drinks to soda or beer and wine is available.  I opted for a complimentary cup of cold H2O stored in the pitchers at the napkin and utensils station.  They even offer discounts if you work in the Fisherman's Wharf area.  I told the gentleman that I didn't qualify because I was actually working out of a North Beach office for the day, and he told me that was close enough and he still gave me the 10 percent off!  I took my food to the big communal table to enjoy.

The hot soup was delicious.  The clear broth was slightly peppery in flavor and loaded with an assortment of fresh vegetables and lots of baby shrimp.  My potato was outstanding.  I'm pretty certain the potatoes are scrubbed so if you feel like being hearty you can eat these with the skin and all.  The skins were rubbed with some salt though so I just stuck to eating the potato without the skin.  The very generous portion of grilled steak in my potato was lean and tender and all of the flavors just worked very well together.

Why the half star deduction?  When I finished my meal and went to discard the paper tray, the potato skin, my napkin and the compostable utensils I was shocked not to find a compost bin anywhere.  They only had an area for trash and an area for recycling.  I can't imagine this place generates much trash considering what they serve and the products they serve their food in.  It just bothered me a little to have to toss compostable stuff into the trash bin.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Found this place on a whim. We were on vacation and had been eating this and that all day and while walking back to the car from the Wharf I looked into the window and said "Is this a baked potato place?!" (what an amazing concept right?!) and then we yelped it, and then we quickly made more room in our bellies. 
Since we had been eating all day we decided to share a shrimp potato, but I could have eaten the whole thing alone! The combo sounds strange but It was delicious! And it looked like they had some tasty desserts, but I didn't get a chance to try.
Also, the staff was very friendly, the interior was cute, and they played some good tunes while we were there. 
I need to try more potatoes... bring Hot Spud to LA!!!
author: Michele B.

description: The potato was huge and had a ton of toppings. The staff was so nice and helpful. They let me try different sauces and stayed very polite while I was having trouble making a choice.
author: Danielle K.

description:
WHOA! I made a quick day trip down to San Francisco, and was feeling a bit hungry. While heading towards the Wharf, I caught Hot Spud out of the corner of my eye, and and thought that I should try it out some time. I hit a restaurant on the Wharf, and after sitting at my table for 15 minutes without so much as being greeted by my server, I walked out and headed back towards Hot Spud. 

Let's talk a little about this brilliant idea. Hot Spud is kind of set up like a Chipotle; however, there medium is a GIANT potato. For around $10, I was served a HUGE Idaho Brown, heaping full of Steak, Cheese, Butter, Peas, Corn, Sauteed Mushrooms, all covered in a delicious Alfredo sauce. I ate damn near ever bit of deliciousness in that little black bowl. A day later, I am sitting at work wishing that there were a Hot Spud location in Sacramento. The ingredients were top notch, the meal was cheap, and fast and most importantly, I was happy, and FULL!!! If you are looking to try something new, and in the Fisherman's Wharf area, I highly recommend Hot Spud.
author: Kenny W.

description: Had the chicken spud - Loved it! Tons of topping selections. Beer and wine very reasonablely priced.  Great service and food quality!
author: Jim V.

description:
Hm hot spud, I'm very glad I finally got the chance to give you guys a try

I would never think a baked potato at a fast food style joint would ever exist but here i was getting one with steak and also got a salad

I guess it's a "healthy" type atmosphere here and they use fresh ideas and ingredients. 

Their salad was TOO simple and so plain. It is definitely something you can make at home. as for their baked potato, it is a unique product. They help you mix the potato so well that it all blends together for a great meal. I prefer this method rather than stuffing a potato and making it look all nice

Lastly, I really enjoyed the skin of the potato, it was well seasoned
author: Kenny L.

description:
A kitschy shop at Fisherman's Wharf? No fucking way.

Hot Spud is a novelty, albeit a tasty one. Getting a decked out potato and a cheap beer certainly beats out that $8 hamburger over at the nearby McDonald's. Those stuck in the area need not die of starvation in the tourist trap capital of the world with this place around.
author: Casey S.

description: Super tasty jacket potatoes! My new favorite spot in this neighborhood. If this place was in the financial district, there would lines around the block at lunch time. I had the veggie, which was excellent. Quick and great for take out.
author: Jammy M.

description: Yummy. Near pier 39. Sadly no public restroom and potatoes were good but kinda small and the food needed more spices.
author: robert a.

description: Never had  a potato like this... All sorts of combos and it makes paying $5 for a spud worth it! Seriously, have you ever had a spud worth paying $5? Well this place will not disappoint you if you give it a go!
author: Brian P.

description: Their manager /owner has very poor customer service and he is super rude. I will never come back here. I hope this  restaurant will close because of him.
author: Victor M.

description: I had intended on dining somewhere else but my GPS took me here instead.  I really lucked out b/c Hot Spud ended up being a hell of a snack.  Welcome to the Subway of baked potatoes - have whatever you want on it and hands down, the best baked potato I've ever had.  I guess I accidentally ordered the Chicken Spud as they stuffed this bad boy w/ chicken, alfredo, bacon, corn, and the default goodies (sour cream, green onions, cheese, butter).  Oh also, apparently everything is gluten-free.  I made some good mistakes this day.
author: Derrick C.

description:
How sweet it is.

Almost two years since my first visit. Hot Spud now has 155 reviews and a 4.5 star average. No doubt driven by the delicious spuds.

Just don't forget to include in your order an outstanding sweet potato brownie. Healthy in size, taste and nutrition.

At least for a brownie.
author: Jason B.

description: I usually don't crave for potatoes but when I do this is the place I will pick: good fast food with cheap price.
author: Yoshikage K.

description: My boyfriend and I have been regulars here for years. Back when we first started coming, every once in awhile we would arrive and they would be out of potatoes, which was super disappointing. Now, we usually order our veggie spuds in advance over the phone to ensure no mishaps and eat in. The order is always ready for us when we arrive, and we love finishing up with a sweet potato brownie.  I am a big fan of the various Tabasco sauce options and have noticed that the music is always great.  The manager is also excellent. Bottom line: Delicious, healthy, reasonably priced option in the Wharf.
author: Noelle F.

description:
Labor day week end at the bay area.

I had been in the area and had not had the chance to visit Fisherman's district.
I was there with a few friends and we were looking for something to eat. A small poll showed that few of them were not too crazy about seafood. Really? not crazy about seafood and looking for something to eat at this place.

Walking around found this place, (to which non of us had been to) but looked promising and decided to go in. 

Check the menu and order. I tried the steak spud, shrimp spud, mixed fruit and nut salad and ceaser salad.

Everything was really good but my fav was the shrimp salad. It came with a chipotle dressing that complemented the whole thing. Fruit and nut salad was solid good and would get it again. They ask you for your name and put it on the order. When I got my food I was a little confused because we did not order a Caesar salad.  When they realized what had happened the salad became compliment of the house. It was good, but I appreciated the gesture a little bit more.


The service is super nice and helpful and the place is nice colorful and clean.
author: Coy M.

description:
Tasty spuds and good with food allergies as this was the reason we went here, but come on guys, clean the freaking place!  There was half eaten food everywhere and we had to sit amongst it after having a bit if a tidy up. Floor filthy!!!!!!  Would have got 5 stars for a quick cheap gluten free feed if there wasn't shit everywhere and staff doing nothing. 
Just got home and coeliac daughter feeling very sick. Maybe not true GF after all!
author: Graham P.

description:
Gluten free? Yes, indeed!
To all you Celiacs this place is amazing! Granted they mainly serve potatoes, soup, and salads... But they have an amazing choice of beverages, but more importantly gluten free sweet potato swirled brownies and cheesecake! Both are absolutely wonderful. 
Anytime I travel to the wharf I head over for at least a brownie. Heads up, the last two times I visited they were out of cheesecake the first time, and I got the last brownie the second. So, evening visits may lend to a disappointing adventure. 
Definitely worth the trip! 
They also cater to other allergies as well! Check out the menu!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
When Boyfriend and I stayed out in San Francisco for our staycation, we headed over to the Fisherman's Wharf area for lunch at "a surprise place I know you'll love," he declared. I was a little skeptical, but his surprises are usually lovely, so I figured it'd be alright no matter where we went.

He took me to Hot Spud. And he was dead on. Because, you see, I have this strange love affair with baked potatoes.

I was introduced to this phenomenon a little late (being Chinese and all, baked potatoes aren't exactly a common choice on the menu), but after I had my first baked potato in high school, I was hooked. Which made Hot Spud an especially wondrous place in my eyes.

They're this little diner-esque place near the Wharf, but far enough away from the main area that it's not consistently bombarded by tourists. The people there make your food to order and are super nice and informative if you've never been there before. I ordered myself the Sausage Spud and Boyfriend got himself The Wharf (I think). Yummmmmm :9 The potatoes are huge and they literally stuff it gratuitously with the items that you order. I was in spud heaven. I think I only managed to consume about 3/4 of my potato before I had to call it quits or explode from tater-stuffed goodness.

I would, hands down, go back again if I were in the area. I only wish they would branch out from San Francisco and come to the east bay so I could consume them more often :(
author: Anna W.

description: This place is awesome! I only stopped by here because it was close to my hotel, but I'm so glad I did! I ordered the Shrimp Spud and it was delicious. They are fast and friendly!
author: Becky R.

description: I frequently stay at the Sheraton next to Hot Spud. I was looking for a place to grab a quick dinner and saw the Yelp reviews for this place. The reviews do not lie. This place is awesome and a great find!  I ordered the steak spud and it was one of the best meals I've had. I will be back on a very regular basis. You're made to feel welcome the second you walk in.
author: Patrick P.

description:
I like baked potato but i also like eo eat the skin.
Well the potato skin was completely hard and unedible.
Also my sour cream on top was bigger than my potato. Again, i like sour cream but it was the whole tub on top of my plate.
Even if i am trying to avoid turist spots in fisherman whatf i think i will not be back.
It is reasonably priced but again, it is a potato topped with canned taste vegetables.
author: Emy B.

description:
A gluten-free meal! At a real restaurant! Well, it's counter service, but everyone was friendly, and the whole concept of a baked potato shop just makes me gleeful. Since going gluten-free, potatoes have become a staple, and this whole place is pretty safe for even a super-sensitive special snowflake like me. The only things on the menu that aren't GF are the croutons and wonton pieces (although I have to ask, couldn't they get some GF croutons in there instead?), and possibly the Bleu cheese, but I don't care about croutons and I'm vegan & allergic, so I don't care about cheese either.

They were really cool about the dairy allergy, using separate utensils for my potato. Potatoes start with base toppings of butter, cheese, and salt, and it was easy to get a dairy-free version. I'd called beforehand to ask about dairy-free alternatives to butter and cheese, and was told they weren't selling well enough so they don't serve them any more. Since Earth Balance (vegan butter) and Daiya cheese can both be frozen, I wish they'd change their mind about this. I actually brought my own tiny containers of both with me and they made my potato infinitely better. (Technically I'd call this a 3-star joint, but since I saved my own potato with my own toppings, the experience was one star better.) 

Bonus points for the black beans offered, because it's hard to get a vegan protein option at most omnivorous restaurants, and nearly all the vegan faux meats are not gluten-free (and never soy-free). Beans are healthy and awesome. Bonus points for corn as a topping, because my partner's favorite (baked or mashed) potato topping is corn. Minus points because my vegetable toppings weren't actually warm. The peas were super cold, and it made most of my potato room temperature. My potato had broccoli (cooked, but not hot), carrots (cooked, room temp), peas, and black beans-- and I apparently got bonus corn, which was also pretty good, just not hot. I'm not sure if that's normal to put cold toppings on a hot potato, but I wish mine had been hot all the way through. It was a chilly foggy day and a warm tater woulda really been a 5 star meal.

The place wasn't very busy on a Sunday evening, and we didn't have any trouble seating our group of 6. It was a really nice experience. It also wasn't very loud, and it was very clean. There are so few places I can eat without getting sick from gluten contamination that I rarely venture out any more. I can't thank them enough for my safe and tasty experience.

I'll definitely go back (and I don't even mind braving the tourists to go there-- we even got a local discount!), but for this place to really shine, they should consider offering Daiya vegan cheese (cheddar, please!), and soy-free Earth Balance margarine. The cheese can be used straight out of the freezer, and the margarine keeps a very long time in the fridge. The desserts were gluten-free but not vegan. One of the desserts was hazelnut rice pudding, which I'm certain could be made vegan easily. (If you're reading this, Hot Spud, I'd be happy to offer substitution suggestions!) If I could have had a dessert after my potato, that would have seriously rocked my world.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
I have been here a few times and have tried something different every time. nothing as let me down. 
The salad with fruit added some shrimp is off the hook good. 
All the spuds are super good, all the sauces are matched with the meats and the spud itself. 

I enjoy everything here
author: Blake R.

description: Highly recommend this unique spot. Gluten free friendly! We had the chicken spud and sausage spud and both were delectable. Kind of nice to have a perfectly cooked baked potatoes loaded with your favorite toppings. They specialize in potatoes, so they've mastered it! This is not like the potato you get as a side dish at another place. This is the MAIN meal and it's great! The desserts are a must try! Brownie, rice pudding, and cheesecake are all gluten free. The two male servers are super friendly and helpful!
author: Mike C.

description: Enjoyed our spuds. Ingredients were fresh. Very satsfying. My husband had the chicken spud with hot wing sauce, I had the veggie with chipotle sauce on the side. Yums!
author: Carole H.

description: A baked potato restaurant - who would've known! I got one with crab, cheese, corn and onion in a lemon butter sauce and it was pretty freakin amazing. Considering you're right next to the pier the crab was awesome. At first I thought the corn would be really weird in it, but I soon learned the corn MADE this! My friend got the chicken one and it was pretty good, as well! I also got their caesar salad with sausage - yum. But i definitely stand by the crab one - oh my. The only thing I dislike is the atmosphere, from other yelpers I do agree it feels very subway/chipotle like. But really chipotle is more comfortable than this place, I'd almost want to take it to go. But the man that helped me was super nice and very accommodating! If you're nearby or are a fan of baked potatoes - stop by Hot Spud!
author: Callan B.

description:
I knew this place had great reviews so when I took my folks to Pier 39, I made sure we went in for lunch and see what the great reviews are for. Now I know!

1. Tasty tasty idea - spud! Tried the veggie with chipotle and Alfredo sauce. Yummy!
2. Great service - everyone was helpful, guided us through the menu and gave us delicious suggestions. 
3. Good location -  3 minute walk from the Pier. 
4. Not expensive. 

I will definitely visit again!
author: Sannidhi J.

description: Very good, not GREAT, but well worth stopping. I had the steak spud, overall a winner, except for the steak. It had an odd texture, tasted fine - with that said, I give it a strong 4 and recommend you go!
author: David M.

description: What is there not to love about a potato?  Add some delicious toppings, and it's a bonus.  I already proclaim that potatoes alone are one, if not the ultimate, of my favorites foods.  Hot Spud catered lunch for my office so it was set up as a "build-your-own" baked potato bar.  Not sure what the setup is like at the restaurant location, but this was a hit.  They brought a variety of meats, veggies, and sauces to load up on top of the giant baked potatoes.  *Important to note that a giant supply of chopped up bacon was included.*  Anyway, moral of the story is that this was a rather tasty baked potato experience.
author: Kristen F.

description: Good food but service can be much better! Got the Wharf spud and the spud was cold, asked if they could reheat it somehow but would not accommodate us. Had to run next door to 7-eleven to use their microwave. Not cool!
author: Nicole C.

description:
Staying late after a class i decided to come here for some dinner before i got home to my dorm and continued to work 
-.-'  ever since i heard of this place i was intrigued. This place is AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!! How does this place survive in this area? *easy* its far enough that the tourists go to some crappy highpriced pub instead, but close enough that everyone else knows about it. I could say that this is the Chipoltle of potatoes, but it POWNS Chipoltle.

I'm the type of girl that asks for her indian food spicy. The guy told me that the sauce that comes with the shrimp spud *what i ordered* was alittle on the spicy side and asked me if it was ok- which made it even more ok in my book. The blueberry Izze soda i got to drink overflowed when the guy opened it for me so he got me another 1 even though i told him it was fine. I was about to get up to get my shrimpy potatoe but the guy said kindly he would bring it to me AND whilst eating he asked me if it was ok and if i wanted anymore sauce or anything free of charge. SO...NICE when does this happen anywhere??

The atmosphere is nice. The guys are even nicer. It reminds me alot of Chipoltles on the inside except without the business-chain awfulness feel. They played alternative and indie music which made things even that much better and calming. 

The shrimp spud was the best potatoe i have ever had! I did not expect much from a potatoe place, this is not like eating a potatoe, i don't know how else to describe it, but its awesome. I hadn't even realized how full i was until i was walking back. For under $8 i was more stuffed than i have ever been on that little in SF probably ever. Idk how they do it- but its SO GOOD. And glutenfree *gluten sensitivities r common* the sauce did have a kick but a delightful 1. I wouldn't say it was spicy persay, i'd say itz exactly how it should be. This place is so amazing and i am even happier i have class down here on Wednesdays, i will so be back!

I was the last person there and i ate extra fast *i typically eat slow* because i didn't want them to wait for me after closing- even though they never pressured me or closed their doors. They actually seemed to take pride in their work and even seemed to enjoy my company as a consumer- also when does that ever happen??!!

Hot Spud- you've officially found a new lover ^.^
author: Brittainie B.

description: This place is good! Just that it's around the corner on Mason. If they were more visible they would be really busy, but Hey. Word of mouth they are good!
author: Sammy S.

description: Good value. The food was good and there was plenty of it. Plenty of ways to customize depending on what kind of mood you're in.
author: Brian P.

description:
This was such a great way to start our afternoon in the city!  We found a great deal on the "Groupon Now Deals" and decided to give it a try.  Definitely worth the $11 for $20!  We were able to get two huge potatoes and two cokes, and only pay an extra $1.52 after using the groupon.  

This was a great, filling meal for a dreary afternoon.  We chose to get two different kinds, the Chicken and the Steak.  The chicken potato was better than the steak, but if you don't like hot sauce the steak would be a good second choice.  If you like potato skin it is a 50/50 chance of good or bad... the skin on the steak potato was perfect, but the skin on the chicken potato was kind of overdone and tough.  The place was still worth 5 stars... the employees were pretty nice as well... the cashier patiently waited about 5 minutes for me to pull up my groupon since my phone app wasn't working correctly.  

I would suggest this place for a good, cheap lunch when you head to the city.  

- Just a tip, I got horrible directions from my cell phone navigation, so be careful if you try google maps for directions.  It's right off of Embarcadero, you don't need to take the whole tour of the city google maps gives you!
author: Lucia R.

description: Luv it! Had 3 guys with us who were't sure about going, but they ended up loving the brownies. We would return
author: Autumn T.

description:
Loved, LOVED, Loved the food and the service!
Was visiting San Fran and Fisherman's Wharf and had a voucher that I bought 'blindly' and WOW! What a pleasant surprise! The spuds were amazing (lots of food for your $, so come hungry!), the staff was VERY friendly, helpful and wonderful!
Over all great experience and so close to all the attractions!
Way to go "Hot Spuds"! Great concept, DELISH food & wonderful staff!
author: Karen K.

description: I absolutely loved this place!  I didn't realize that all they sold was baked potatoes when I decided to go there, but it's such a unique idea, and they did it well!  I stood there in awe for a few minutes just taking in the whole concept.  They have pre made options for what to put on your baked potato or you can create your own.  I'm gluten free, and I would have just assumed that baked potatoes and whatever you can imagine to put on them would be gluten free, but the staff went out of their way to mention that all the meats and sauces were gluten free and not to worry.  They paid such good attention and care to their customers, and the baked potato i had was awesome (alfredo sauce and chicken and peas and corn i think?).  I will definitely be sure to go back next time i'm in town.
author: Kate L.

description:
I work a block from this place and did a Yelp search for "Salad" near "Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco".  Had seen this place in passing before but assume the "Spud" in "Hot Spud" meant potatoes and not much else.  So when I found the menu on their website included salads, I decided to give it a try, and called in my order for pick-up in a few minutes.  I chose the Thai Crunch Signature Salad with added chicken and it was ready when I walked in.  Told them that I'd liked the fact that it was listed as gluten-free and I love a good salad.  

Emphasis on GOOD salad.  Unfortunately, this one kind of missed the mark a bit.  

What missed was flavor in the peanut dressing.  Just wasn't very zippy and seemed tired.  Not enough dressing, either... seems like it was watered down so that the salad ingredients were covered with SOMETHING, but that something seemed very thin and bland.  A dressing should glisten and have real pep.  This wasn't it.  

Also, the mandarin orange slices were limp and looked like they were old and falling apart.  Too long in the can, perhaps?  I like canned mandarins in my salads at home, but they usually come out of the can firm and plump and flavorful.  These were mushy... not good at all.  

Overall, I give them a 3 (1 for the salad, 1 for the service and 1 for the neighbor discount)... decent service to have it ready in the 5 minutes from the time I called to walk over and pick it up, and overall fresh ingredients in the mix... and plenty of them.  

But the peanut dressing needs to get REAL and spice it up to a real Thai experience.  If you guys really make your dressings from scratch, try this recipe I use:

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/thai-peanut-dressing/

And the mandarins should always be checked for firm plumpness when they're taken from the can to the set-up bin.  You'd think those food service supply companies would make sure their #10 cans have fresh product in them.  

One extra thumbs-up for a 10% "neighbor discount" because I work around the corner.  But only a better dressing and fresher mandarins will bring me back for another salad.  Tell me you've done better and I'll definitely be back.  

Potatoes aren't my thing but salads are.
author: K.C. F.

description:
HOT SPUD IS AWESOME!!! 
Never knew a baked potato could be a meal. After walking passed Hot Spud a couple of times trying to avoid going in to buy the Sweeth Potato Brownie that is advertised in the window, I finally just broke down. Glad I did! I ended up getting the Veggie Spud and boy was is great! It was loaded with everything. After that night, I was there every night for the next couple of nights while visiting San Fran. One of those nights my boyfriend bought the Thai Crunch Salad and we didn't realize until we arrived back at the hotel that the dressing wasn't put into the bag. He went back to Hot Spud and the young lady there was so apologetic. She gave him the salad dressing, $5.00 back and a spud for the inconvenience. Such great customer service.....The staff is awesome!!
author: Sharlena S.

description: I ordered the shrimp potato without the black olives. It was really good. The sauce that comes with it is called chipotle tarter sauce. It's different but in a good way. Overall my experience was memorable. I recommend getting the Anchor Steam beer with your meal, sitting at a hightop, and watching the tourists trip over their children.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Hot potato
Found this place on yelp when we desparately needed quick food before we boarded our boat to Alcatrez island. Very modern, very friendly, quick & clean service. 
Affordable but with a drink it might tip you over 10 bucks. 

How does it taste. 
to be fair I already liked the regular baked potatoes that they sell at most places including wendys but this place does it up a couple of levels. I mean a giant potatoe with the insides filled with sausage in my case. Crab in my brother's case. alot of cheeese and other magic ingrediants. 

their drink selection is pretty awesome too with soda pops and regular sodas.
author: Zan O.

description: Service is very bad. Staffs are unfriendly and place is dirty. There was no napkin instead a toilet paper towel was placed at the counter in exchange of the napkin. Rude middle eastern guy. Unpolite and uncourteous. Wiping the counter with a dirty cloth.
author: Luisa C.

description:
It is never okay to place a box that has been on the floor on top of a food preparation surface. It is also never okay to prepare food without gloves on both hands, especially when the ungloved hand touches the food and food surfaces and utensils. It is not okay to move from storage and cleaning or cashier to food prep without washing your hands. 

I got the sausage spud, and the pork sausage was not kept at the appropriate hot temperature before serving... it was way too cold. The only warm thing on my potato was the potato. The vegetables were all canned and not fresh. The chipotle sauce contained a dairy product, but it was also suspiciously room temperature. 

The food was high in sodium and low in flavor (probably a result of being canned). I would never come back. If this is 4.5 stars in North Beach, I'd hate to see what the other restaurants in this touristy neighborhood are like. 

$9 for a bland baked potato? Never again.

PS - they do not compost. Major San Francisco fail.
author: Bootylicious J.

description: I am not a fan of having a potato on its own but Hot Spud made me go WOW! We had a Veggie one and one chicken spud and i swear we did not speak for the 10-15 odd minutes that we were eating. Totally recommended! Oh and great service too.
author: Shruti D.

description: I love Hot Spud! It's great food, service, and people, at an excellent price. There food is not processed, like so many of the food chains you see at Fisherman's Wharf. They make the food quickly, without losing any of the quality.
author: Kenny T.

description: We had the salad and veggie hot spud, and they were excellent, we're looking forward to coming again soon.
author: Swaroop C.

description: nice option to all the fish and chips and richness in the area /// fun & different lunch::: the ingredients seemed fresh, everything tasted good and we were overall happy on our choice to try something new.  we had the vegetarian with crab and lemon beurre blanc, the steak one, the vegetarian with chipotle and a mandarin salad.  the only thing I wish was for a lighter option for a sauce and everything tasted a little bit sweet (although our pallets are prob dif than most).  the service was great and I wish them great success.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I'm not kidding when I say that this baked potato was the highlight of a 7 day California vacation for my wife. Just about everything in the restaurant is gluten free and my wife went with the chicken spud loaded with everything. She was so happy eating the potato that I honestly started to get a little jealous hearing her moan and exclaim with every bite. She even got up when she was done and gave the guy at the counter an extra tip - I was worried she might start making out with him. 

Needless to say this place is highly recommended if you're looking for a GF lunch option near Fisherman's Wharf or if you're a potato lover.
author: Brian W.

description:
I'm trying to workout more lately so my body can match my totes rad personality; and I can hopefully rid myself of the ever dreaded FUPA. However, I have learned if I do not eat something prior to my dreaded death workouts, about 30 minutes in, I want to kill someone, and that someone is usually myself. 

Enter Hot Spud. My Wednesday Zumba/Spin savior. For about $7 I can get a delicious potato loaded with vegetables that not only gives me a much needed boost of energy, but also doesn't leave me feeling like a slovenly disgusting pig. The location is incredibly convenient, service is fast (HELLA fast), and the window seat is great for people watching. And by people watching I mean eye fucking Euro tourists. 

Their desserts look good too, but in the interest of my ass I decided to avoid them. Until next week at least.
author: Jillian M.

description:
We stopped by right as it opened for lunch the other day.  We were welcomed in by the extremely friendly staff.  I ordered the Wharf Spud (crab, onions, corn, etc.) and my girlfriend ordered the Steak Spud (steak, olives, alfredo sauce).  Total came to about $25, after drinks and tax.  

Our potatoes came out after a few minutes of preparation.  They loaded up the potatoes big time with the toppings.  The corn, onions, and cheese gave the potatoes a very colorful look.  And as good as these potatoes looked, the taste was even better.  Both of our potatoes tasted extremely fresh.  My Wharf Spud contained real crab, and it went very well with the hot potato.  It was a very filling and delicious lunch.

And just a disclaimer: I am not a huge fan of baked potatoes.  But next time I am in the area, I am definitely going to make another trip to Hot Spud.  That's how good it is!
author: King T.

description: Whoa! This place gives you quite the meal! Glad I gave this a try,  coming back on my next visit for sure!
author: Mick M.

description: The food and the service here is absolutely outstanding. You get top quality food and ingredients for a great price along with wonderful customer service. I work about a block away so we order food here pretty often and the quality is consistent. I would highly recommend eating here!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Pretty impressed, fast service, nice guys. Great quick place to get a bite to eat. We got the number one seller. Chicken potatoe with hot wing sauce, that was delish. And then custom made one with cheese and broccoli for the girls.
author: J T.

description:
When friends want to wander the waterfront I no longer let out a painful groan because I know I can take them to Hot Spud for lunch. 

I tried the Wharf potato and it was tasty and very filling. The place is only a block up from the tourist trap but that seemed to be enough to keep them at bay.
author: Jordan P.

description:
Being gluten-free I was glad to find this place. The location is a little hidden and the parking isn't ideal but it's worth the time. It's so relaxing going into a restaurant and not having to worry about which items you can eat off the menu. Everything here is gluten free!! Even the desserts! Definitely try the brownies when you're there, they are delicious and soft!!
You don't have to be gluten-free to enjoy this place, I've brought my friends here and they loved it too! Everything is perfectly priced, c'mon you people who complain about the pricing.. This is San Francisco after all!!
And the owners are such a nice couple! Will definitely be coming here more often now that I'm moving closer to the area!! Love you Hot Spud!!
author: Olga D.

description: Very nice folks, good service.  A potato is a pretty humble spud but it's so satisfying on a cold blustery day near Fisherman's wharf.  Add in the myriad ways in which the super friendly staff here dress up perfectly baked potatoes with tasty fixins' and you've got a great lunch time break spot!
author: Alan S.

description: Was in hurry bought an amazing piece of cake and coffee.  Won't forget to visit again !
author: J A.

description: Great food! I've tried a few of the different spuds and I can't decide which one I like the best. I do wish however that the staff was more welcoming and friendly.
author: Lisa V.

description: Friendly service and the Steak Spud was delicious! Yes, you're paying almost $8 for a baked potato, but I guarantee you it is worth it. Almost everything at Fisherman's Wharf is beyond overrated, but Hot Spud is a legit gem in a pool of tourist-bait crap.
author: Katie S.

description: I'm a huge spud fan, so what better than a food place dedicated to taters? Giant taters with every type of topping, sweet tater pie? Sadly, I was disappointed. Yes, you can have your ginormous spud but seriously the place is an overgrown airport takeaway joint. No ambience at all for the $7 minimum potatoes. You feel like shoving it down as fast as possible and running out along the scenery-less street.  Portions are okay, but I mean a potato costs like $.50c so to say it is cheap is totally going overboard.  The staff is okay, they don't bring things to you, as mentioned it's a takeaway place.
author: Colleen H.

description:
Foodie awesomeness. Real food real people really good. The only place besides Pat's cafe and Taqueria San Jose #3 where you can find a quick meal that won't kill you in 20 years. Two thumbs up
Hint: get the steak spud!
author: Antoinette C.

description: My wife and I were just about to take a cab out from Fisherman's Wharf when we stumbled on Hot Spud. We stopped for an after dinner snack, and I'm so glad we did. The place was empty, but the staff was super friendly. We shared a potato with bacon for just like $6, and the portion was quite generous! Wasn't overdone with the butter or cheese either and in fact felt incredibly light for essentially being a loaded potato. Turned out to be one of the better surprise finds of our trip and will definitely stop here again in the future!
author: Patrick H.

description: Had the veggie potato and the GF sweet potato chocolate brownie and they were both amazing. Celiac friendly.
author: SillYak 1.

description: This place is awesome. Came here before the firework show and I was very impressed. The pre made spuds were what we ordered. We got our order very quickly and employees did not hesitate to offer is sauces to try with our potatoes. Staff was excellent and friendly. We stayed in there for maybe 20 minutes but left blown away. Not bad for just randomly stumbling into this place for a quick bite
author: Mark S.

description: One of the best baked potatoes I've ever had! I was walking from the parking garage to fishermans wharf and good thing I took the route I took because I discovered this gem! I ordered "the wharf" and it was perfectly cooked. There was corn cheese butter onions and green onions, with sour cream but what topped it off was the crab in the center ! The crab was not imitation either. It was sooooooo good. I will make sure I stop by everytime I hit the city. I'm so glad I found this place! I'm just a big fan of potatoes maybe that's why I like this place so much lol
author: Guen S.

description:
Dear Hot Spud, 
Thank you for being the only place in Fisherman's Wharf to get hot, yummy vegan and vegetarian food.
I know that you have bacon and cheese and steak potatoes too, but for me, I am in love with your simple potato with broccoli and sautéed mushrooms. So cheap, so filling, so vegan.
I also love your selection of stevia sweetened organic sodas. You clearly rock.
Sincerely, 
Local that works down here.
author: S N.

description: excellent grub and Gluten-Free brownies and cheesecake, are you kidding me?!?!  One of the best G-F desserts i have ever had.  Staff was very friendly especially considering the fact that we walked in about 2 munutes before they closed for the day.
author: Todd B.

description:
The idea of Hot Spud is so simple: baked potatoes customized with your choice of toppings, and so so good! I love that they are so accommodating w/ substitutions. The boyfriend and I had the vegetarian baked potato but added sausage.

Only downside would be that the preparation is a little slow. But the staff is extremely friendly, and it's different from all the other food options in the area. Five stars!
author: Catherine C.

description:
My boyfriend and I keep seeing this place when were at Pier 39 and wanted to try it. My boyfriend saw a Groupon deal for it, $12 for $20. We both ordered something different so I got the steak spud and he got the chicken spud. And 2 sodas to balance the groupon spent. 

The chicken spud was good, but a bit spicey. I liked mine better. It was a big potato with stuff that i ate like half. If you like/love potatos, I think this is a place for you. :)

We probably will go here if we are craving potato and havent aten. :)
author: Gen M.

description: Best potatoes I've ever eaten. But then again, when you slather butter, sour cream, onions, cheese, and then top it off with crab meat, how can you ever go wrong?
author: Andy C.

description:
This place isn't bad. I always wanted to try this place. I saw a Groupon Now deal, $12 for $20 worth of food so I bought it and came here with my girlfriend.

We each got a different item. I had the chicken spud and she got the steak spud. We also grabbed 2 sodas and paid the difference which was $1.52. Not bad. $13 lunch for 2 people.

The chicken spud was good. Its a bit spicy but I liked it. I had a couple of bites of my girlfriends steak spud. It wasn't bad at all. She liked it. No complaints.

This place is on the pricier side. It cost about $7-$9 for one gourmet baked potato. But its not bad since you are in the smack middle of Pier 39, one of the biggest tourist traps in San Francisco.

If you do choose to come here, get their Groupon Now deal! I will definitely be back! =)
author: Daniel S.

description: Read a bunch of very good reviews and thought to give it a shot. Tried a  seafood one and the veg one. Lacked flavor and seasoning.
author: Sandeep K.

description: All I can say is this place rocked. The service was remarkable; both the server and cashier were wonderful and patient. But the food itself was mouthwatering. It was the best baked potato I had, and the multiple flavors merging together in the spud made the price completely worth it--did I mention the potato is huge? I would definitely recommend Hot Spud to anyone visiting San fransisco.
author: Ano N.

description:
I've never been a fan of Mr or Mrs Potato Head. I think they're creepy looking, quite frankly. Due to this aversion, I've also been a little skeptical and put off by places that offer "dressed up" potatoes. Yes, I'm going to blame THAT on my childhood...because I can....and Yelp therapy is free.
That all being said, when you're in cold-ass Fisherman's Wharf with a 3 year old and a fellow Kauaian on a budget; you want something cheap, hot, close to the hotel, close to your parking space, and low-key. This place is AWESOME. I should have also mentioned that all 3 of us are gluten free (okay, so my friend is only SOMETIMES gluten free but still). 
Alana and I each got the chicken spud...it kind of reads like a hot wing...and I LOVE me some hot wings! Cheese, chicken, hot wing sauce, sour cream, olives, corn all atop a generous potato. It was perfect! We also got the sweet potato brownies which Alana dubbed "the best gluten free ANYTHING I've ever had!"...they were moist, flavorful, chocolatey....nom nom nom nom.
