Alana literally asked them what time they opened the next day (she was staying across the street LOL) and when they would have more (we bought the last two). We each had a glass of wine and the staff was so amazing that they let us stay almost 2 HOURS after they closed (we thought they closed at 9 but they closed at 7)...seriously...WHO does that?! It was awesome and I think it's probably the best food and value (certainly for gluten free) in the area. All that goodness and it was less than $30! 24 hours of parking up the street will cost you the same amount...but it'll leave a shitty taste in your mouth.
author: Jill D.

description:
I am in lesbians this place. I would order with less salt, and maybe less cheese. And always sour cream on the side. Maybe less butter too. 

Service is AWESOME. The owner is friendly AND funny, and the workers are just great. The wait isn't too long either.

Restaurant is tiny, but it's cute and clean and the potatoes are so easy to eat and very shareable. 

Other than that... I dunno. I just love potatoes and I love veggies and it's really awesome.

Oh. The only critique I have is that it's in a really strange place. I feel like this would do great downtown Palo Alto, Mountain View, Los Altos, anywhere, just not the wharf area. Kind of like... seems more like a locals place, but it's in a really touristy area? I dunno, I'm just saying because I want it to move closer to me.
author: Hayne P.

description:
Wish we had one of these in Ohio! Great for those looking to eat gluten free. Same idea as Chipotle, but mixing it up with Baked Potatoes. They put everything you want and more. 

Very reasonably priced. 

The sweet potato cheese cake is sooo good to.
author: Caresse s.

description:
I found this place through Yelp, which was awesome because it seems like there are so few really good restaurants/eateries near the wharf and Pier 39.  This place lived up to its rave reviews.  The potatoes were huge and easily splittable between 2 people. They fluff up the potato to give it a wonderful consistency and the toppings are amazing.  I went here twice with my girlfriend during a very recent visit to SF, and we shared the chicken spud  both times because it was so good.  However, I must say that unlike most Yelpers who reviewed this place, I was not a fan of their sweet potato cheesecake.  The slice was very small for being almost $4 and I didn't really like the flavor.  Personally, I think The Cheesecake Factory's pumpkin cheesecake is much better, so minus one star for that.  

I do hope to see this place still in business on my next visit to SF.  It didn't really ever seem crowded.
author: J. S.

description:
Baked potatoes! One of my favorite foods of all time.

You can't go wrong with this place, you get to pick your toppings and they all look so good I am tempted to put them ALL on.
author: Kina M.

description: If you want a nice food at affordable price, this is the place. The salads that we ordered was delicious and fresh.  Close to major area attractions. Friendly staff ! Recommended!
author: Fernando N.

description:
Good spuds, expensive for what it is. A place to try. 
Interesting place. in that you get a potato and they put stuff in it.  Think of it like a chipotle of potatoes.  
So if you really like customizable hot potatos this is your place.  
I figured I would give it a try cause when else would I go to a place like this?
I got the chicken one with everyone on it.  It had a very hot wings kind of flavor, which to me is lacking.  I would come back to try the beef version as it looked pretty good.  
It was also incredibly slow, as there was just 3 of us and it took quite a while.  I wouldn't think of going here during the dinner or lunch rush.  They were nice though.  
Gluten free because it's all potatoes. 
For the price the truck thing I went to was better.
author: Dr K.

description: Long story short the food here is great and staff is awesome. Can't recommend enough. I got the steak spud which is great as always and if they have the sweet potato brownies out I would recommend too.
author: Richard S.

description:
Pros:
* It can (in theory) be a healthy meal. Yet it's very filling!
* The execution, ingredients and flavors are excellent.
* The main chef (I'm assuming - he was training other staff) is very involved, and really seems to care about what his customers think.
* Instead of making everybody custom build a spud-meal, they give you a set of configurations. This would probably make orders faster when the place is busy.

Cons:
* This is probably the most expensive spud you will ever buy.  (However, it's cheap for a meal if you think about it that way.)

Overall, I recommend it if you like potatoes, and you've not yet experienced Hot Spud.
author: Andrew M.

description: Guys this is one great place!!  Healthy, tasty, and a great price!  What more could you ask for????
author: Riz G.

description:
Wait? An all potato restaurant mere blocks from my house?!! EUREKA!!! 

POTATOES! 

GD I love them.

In fact they are one of my four food groups and I'm pretty sure my body composition is 35% potatoes. My Polish ancestors would approve.  

So many expectations and I was not disappointed! The people that work there are super fantastic, you can choose from many of the fresh toppings or there are a bunch of combo options to pick out on the menu. They mash it all up in front of you with butter and cheese and then let you go to town. The cherry on top of this wonderful carbohydrate sundae? Wine! Yes. They serve wine and beer. 

Happy days!
author: Eli B.

description:
I've been going to Hot Spud for about a year and a half now & I am glad to say that it has never let me down.  However, I may be biased since I only order the steak spud, but it's so good every time that I find myself craving HS a few times a month.  If your looking for something DIFFERENT around the Wharf, go to hot spud.  

Also, their sweet potato brownies are incredible.  Save room!
author: Brian M.

description: I was so excited to eat at this place when I came to San Francisco for the first time with my husband...and so disappointed with the result. The food was decent and most of it is safe for gluten-free people (like me). But the staff was SO RUDE that we will not be going back. They made a mistake on our order and then had an attitude when we politely asked them to change it. As we were leaving, one staff member rudely called out, "Hey! Did you pay?" We had payed when we ordered....it's fast food style. Wow. Awful, awful service. We will never be going back
author: Sarah H.

description:
Great little restaurant for a snack.  Not ideal for a lunch or dinner kind of meal.  Spuds are made quickly.  Only problem is that you need to check if they give me all that they promised.  I mean, we ordered 2 veggie spuds on our first visit and even though the menu said it contains black olives, we did not find any in our spuds.  The second time, we made our own spuds and we could not find any green onions in our spuds even though it comes free :(

But on the whole, it is a place for a quick snack and the spuds (we have tried only veggie spuds) taste great!  Tried the sweet potato brownie and it was awesome!! 

Noise level is a bit annoying.
author: Viji K.

description: Staying nearby for business and needed a easy quick bite. This place is great. Friendly service and an easy menu to find what you want. I had the Wharf Spud and it was lovely. Not chinsy on the crab btw!!
author: Beth O.

description:
I too came here during the Living Social deal not sure what to expect since loaded baked potatoes is a new restaurant concept for me. I was happily surprised! 4 of us all got different things and we left full. They have tons of fresh toppings, as well as sauces like chipotle tartar or spicy wing! 

Instead of a potato I got a salad - the Thai Crunch with chicken. It was made to order and really flavorful. The thai peanut dressing was very good without being too heavy. They also have many sodas AND beer! 

Overall a great place for lunch, just wish they were in a different location as I know most locals don't venture here often. Come to the Financial District!! I think this would be really popular for a lunch to go.
author: Natalie N.

description:
I highly recommend this place.

We went in here today, after seeing great reviews on Yelp, to get some dinner. I got the steak, and my friend got the chicken. Both were really good, and unique.. not just a change of meat. They definitely put a lot of thought into what goes into each special. They also offer a plain version, with your choice of toppings, which is great for the picky eaters.

The location is a little hard to find because there is a tree (i think) obstructing the logo, so it is harder to see from the main street. I hope people see this on yelp and go there, because I want one on every corner!

Also, don't think of it as just a snack, it really fills you up!
author: Zach A.

description: I gave this place  5 stars because of the awesome service! I had the stuffed potato with crab meat not knowing what to expect, and I have to say it was really REALLY good. I also had the caesar salad but it wasn't like the traditional caesar salad, its much better and healthier. The salad was lightly dressed with a hint of citrus and mixed with parmesan cheese. For dessert we had a sweet potato brownie which was amazing. Great food, awesome staff and in walking distance to pier 39.
author: Jen L.

description:
How awesome! I was in town on business and this is the first place I went to. It's great because it's perfectly set up for single eaters and you don't have to feel awkward when the waiter comes by and takes away the second plate at your table.

It's quick service. It's potatoes. They also have salads, sides, and beer. You can pick from one of their many pre-designed potatoes or you can make one up. Like Subway, it's made fresh. Unlike Subway, it's way better.

I had a veggie potato with bacon (I know, I'm not really a vegetarian). Including a drink, I'd say the whole thing came out to be less than $10. Most of the utensils are made from that recycled potato stuff and they definitely have separate disposal areas for recycling and trash. Love it.

If you're in the Wharf area and you don't want some overpriced, "shi shi" sort of place that overlooks the bay and touts the "best [insert seafood name here] in San Francisco" try out this place. It's beyond well priced and more than enough food for one person.
author: Lauren P.

description:
I absolutely adore potatoes in every form, so a restaurant devoted entirely to my favorite tuber? i'm sold.  

Afraid of being overwhelmed by tourists at the wharf on a Saturday night, we braved Hot Spud and to our excitement, the restaurant was relatively quiet (though i hope it picks up in the future once word gets out...but not too much that i'll have to wait hours for a potato).  I already knew going in I was going for "the wharf" Crab, corn, red/green onions, cheese, butter, deliciousness.  

1st of all, the potatoes themselves are very good.  I frequently make baked potatoes for dinner for myself at home, and none of my potatoes are as big and delicious as these.  I'm not a huge fan of the skins when I have a baked potato, but at Hot Spud, I couldn't stop eating the potato, even the skin!

2nd of all, the toppings are generous, fresh, and oh so good.  I highly recommend anything and everything here even though I've only tried one flavor so far.  I'm that confident that this place serves delicious food.  

3rd of all, get the sweet potato cheesecake.  We tried both that and the brownie, and while both good, the cheesecake definitely stood out above the brownie.  

I hope this place does well and sticks around for awhile because the potato deserves such a restaurant to showcase its glorious taste, and Hot Spud rises to the occasion.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: This is a down to earth San Francisco joint that honestly had the best baked potato I've had in my lifetime. A friendly staff and diverse menu make this place a go-to for late nights. If you're a local you get a discount too! They just recently opened shop in SF and they are doin it right! I'll be coming back every week!
author: Darren D.

description: My fiancée and I stopped in here while walking down to fisherman's wharf. We were starving and this place received good reviews. I ordered the chicken potato and my fiancée got the steak potato. Both were delicious! Both of them had ingredients that I would never think to put on a potato. The chicken potato had corn, black olives, buffalo sauce, sour cream, and a bunch of other stuff I don't remember but it was delicious! The service was also really great. We waited for maybe one minute when we walked in and the gentleman behind the counter told us he would be right with us and then apologized for the (nonexistent) wait. A woman in a wheel chair ordered after us and he brought her food out to her and helped get her get set up at a table with silverware and condiments. For two potatoes, a root beer, and a bottle of water it was right around $20. Great tasting food, great service, and a great price!
author: Moira R.

description:
I know.  It's weird.  Don't let that stop you from trying it.

You can get out of here for just over $10, which makes it cheap food (hard to find in SF).  It is incredibly filling - and tasty too.  

So they take a potato, cut it open and throw butter on it.  They top it with small pieces of meat (so you don't have to cut them) and some other veggies.  Sour cream and chives top most dishes.

The shrimp spud is great.  The chicken is pretty good too.  If for nothing else, go for the experience!
author: Ted H.

description: This is a great idea!  I love this concept, and wish I had a place like this in Atlanta.  If you get the broccoli on your potato though be careful...they don't cut it up and give you huge chunks.  It would be better if they would cut it to use just the florets.  I did like the fact that they had plastic cups with a pitcher of water available for those who did not want to pay $2 for a bottle of water.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Lots of topping choices for their huge baked potatoes.  For $7.45 you can choose four toppings and a sauce.  Salads and toppings are all fresh.  Friendly service.
author: Donna D.

description:
Cool spot!  In this area, most eating options are either industrially-made fast-food, or overpriced crowded tourist-traps.

Decor was really nice and artsy.

It's owned and run by a young couple, and that's really inspiring to me.  They are really nice people.

As for the food... they were a little on the slow side.  As time goes on, I think they'll get "in the groove" more and be able to handle more people at once.  If you need something to do while waiting, get a beer - they're only $3.25!  When my food did arrive, however, it was really good. They'll make a potato pretty much any way you want it.

Also of note - they make salads too.  It's hard to find a quick take-out joint that will make a fresh salad, but this place squarely fits the bill there.
author: Mike R.

description: Tasty!  Who knew that potatoes could have so much variety.  I ordered the chicken spud which was pretty tasty -- maybe I'm a baked potato purist, but I think I may have liked the good ol' fashioned bacon/sour cream/chive combo a bit better.  The staff was really friendly and accommodating though - always a plus.
author: Mel G.

description:
A friend of mine told me about this place. I also never really Yelp about a place unless I feel that I need to either rant or rave about it. It's a new restaurant near pier 39. First, I'm a big fan of potatoes.  When it comes to gourmet potatoes, this place means business. Today, I tried the chicken spud and accompanied it with a fiesta salad. Oh my.. the potato was cooked just right and the ingredients complimented each other very well. The salad was very delicious and you could tell, all the vegetables were fresh and prepared with love. In the end, I had the sweet potato brownie. That was delicious. Very moist and flavorful.

The staff was very friendly and very helpful in helping you decide what kind of spud you want.

I will definitely go back. I wish this place the best!
author: Ed M.

description:
Wow, I'm so glad I randomly stopped by this place! I work near by and am so happy to have found a delicious spot to get lunch. 

Their dishes are made with love right in front of you. It's a new restaurant and you can tell they put everything they've got into making great food for each customer. 

I got a spud with chicken, and got to add whatever veggies and sauces I wanted. I ate the whole thing... I mean the ENTIRE THING! MMM... Loved it.

This place has made me actually look forward to the crummy winter weather, just so that I can eat Hot Spud's and be comforted from the cold!
author: Meredith S.

description:
i love baked potatoes! I was very excited to try this place tonight. when we got there, there were only two people sitting inside and we were looking over the menu. another couple walked in and the people working there told all 4 of us that there were only two potatoes left and because we got there first, we had to decide if we wanted them or not.  we felt bad for the other couple, but i had been waiting all day for this.  it was nice that they let us decide first, but it was a bit awkward.

i had the wharf, which has crab, corn, and onions. it was pricey but delicious. i could only eat about half of it, the potatoes are so big here!
my husband got the chicken and it was delicious!  they mush up the potato and ingredients a bit for you and have lots of tabasco sauce, salt, and pepper for you to use.

i would definitely come back here, hopefully soon, and will be dreaming of potatoes until then!
author: Yummy E.

description:
After researching where to find gluten free restaurants in San Francisco I decided to give Hot Spud a try. This was definitely a good decision!

First of all I love potatoes! So this is the place for me. Hot Spud is a nice and clean fast food type of place. They have a choice of differently filled baked potatoes, salads, soups and desserts. I chose the shrimp filled potato and it was simply delicious. The shrimp were grilled and really really good. I loved the whole arrangement. I added a cesar  salad which had freshly shaved parmesan on top and a very tasty dressing. My husband had the same potato but added crabmeat which tasted very fresh. I ordered the sweet potato cheesecake to go so I could enjoy it later. Everything was wonderful. Including the staff. Very nice and friendly people!

As someone sensitive to gluten it is a real challenge to find a place to eat out. At Hot Spud one does not have to worry about cross contamination because everything (besides croutons which can be added to your salad) is gluten free!

I will definitely be back!
author: Daniela Y.

description:
Love this place!  I go to school around the corner at Alliant, and there is just no good place to get lunch that isn't full of tourists or ridiculously overpriced.  I ordered a potato with veggies and grilled shrimp and I couldn't have been more pleased!  Shrimp was grilled in front of me, veggies were fresh and the potato was devoured quickly.  A bonus: super friendly staff and reasonably priced!  Also, you can build a salad and the ingredients are super fresh.

I will most definitely be returning!
author: Amber H.

description:
Good potatoes, even better prices. Nice & clean place. 

But I wish they wouldn't play techno music... it makes people eat faster, which isn't very healthy. I noticed the music and had to make a special effort not to eat along with the music.
author: Wendy M.

description:
walked in last week with hubby and baby after we saw what looked like a potato place..really? Brought up in New Zealand we definitely miss our baked potatoes. 

We got the chicken spud. The moist potato combined with crunchy Bacon just tasted amazing! Friendly staff and 10% local discount ...woohoo. I feel an addiction coming on...
author: isis n.

description:
If you want to get full quickly and inexpensively, this is the perfect place to go.  
If you would like to eat healthy, you can ask them to hold butter and cheese.
author: David O.

description:
Passed several pizza bars and burger joints and found this gem. Great, flavorful and moist baked potato with many options for toppings.  Mine had sausage, corn, peas and some kind of Alfredo sauce. 
The server asked us to wait an extra 10 minutes for fresh potatoes but offered us free drinks. Not something you would expect in the Fisherman's Wharf Area.
author: Stephen T.

description: The premise is pretty simple: baked potatoes with toppings. This is executed very well, and there are plenty of options to choose from. I ordered The Wharf, which was prepared and served in only a few minutes. The result was a delicious crabby and potatoey treat. I can't wait to return and try the other ones!
author: Sean W.

description:
The potoatoes are like A slightly smaller version of my head on Steroids!!

These huge Babies are amazing. From the way they blend the butter and cheese into the potato to the unbelivable amount of toppings and sauces they offer. This place is sure to get to the heart of any potato or salad lover as the salads have fresh greens and any of the topping you can have on your potato, you can also put on your salad! OMG! 

I am leaving this one short and sweet and suggest that if you are in the Wharf. 1 block before you hit Jefferson so its not as crowded..stop by and grab yourself one of these monsters. 

I usually tell them to surprise me and it has been a good surprise every single time!!
author: Damien K.

description: This restaurant was right around the corner from our hotel and I hesitated to try because I questioned how good you could really make something as simple as a baked potato, but they were terrific! We had the buffalo chicken spud and one of the fruit salads. The potato was excellent, great flavor in the meat and plenty of it! The salad was fresh and had lots of strawberries and just the right amount of dressing. The owner and employees were friendly and helpful and they do have a restroom for customers! Great, simple place!
author: Julie B.

description:
I have been there 4 times in one month..and whenever I meet my friends in Wharf I suggest them to go to Hot Spud..
until now I tried chicken, wharf and shrimp spuds..and i think my favorite is shrimp spud..I never could imagine that shrimp and baked potato can suit each other..but somehow they managed it..so they gained my appreciation..;) 
i'm sure that i'll go there after this time also..with bringing my friends..
author: mert k.

description: WOW!  I love this place.  Came in from out of town and was looking for a healthy place to snap up dinner after my work-out.  I looked at the menu online and hit it up when I was done with my run.  The guys who work here are really nice and it was empty, since it was 5 pm so I got lucky and missed the dinner rush.  I ordered a custom potato with black beans, sauteed mushrooms, black olives and feta cheese (on the side).  Just a tip, they mix cheese (cheddar jack) and butter INTO the potato before they put the toppings on so if you would like a healthier option, get that stuff on the side.  I opted for butter, buffalo wings sauce and feta - on side.  The potatoes are on the large side so I wouldn't recommend this for a snack.  I also ordered a Thai Crunch Salad that I'm going to save for lunch.  I'm getting full from the potato.  This will definitely hit my rotation when I come into town.  So glad I found this place.  Thanks Yelpers!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Wow wow wow. Welcome to my mouth, super loaded potato! We got the sausage potato with generous amounts of sliced sausage, peas, sour cream, kernels of corn (huh?), bits of green onion, and cheese. It was the BEST baked potato I have ever met. And the service here was great. Because they were baking more potatoes we had to wait 15 minutes, but we got a nice little discount on our bill (no sales tax). I will take the bus here to try the whole menu. 

I don't like the piece of art on the wall with dots, though.
author: Kimmie M.

description:
Damn but that was one tasty potato!

I didn't see a vegan option.  Admittedly, I didn't ask about soy cheese...

But the Veggie Potato was excellent!  First they gut the potato and sew some lovely cheese into it.  And then it's sauteed mushrooms, peas, olives, and onions.

Also worth mentioning: the folks behind the counter were super-nice.  If only we had that kind of service in Ocean City, MD!
author: Evan L.

description:
This is a good place to go if you're looking for a basic, low cost cafe near the Wharf, and has vegetarian/gluten free options. The staff was very courteous and accommodating with substitutions, and the food well-prepared. 

The bathroom could use a good cleaning, however. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars.
author: Josie E.

description: My veggie potato was pretty good... happy to have found a gluten free vegetarian friendly spot in SF while we were there visiting :)
author: Lizzy P.

description: I love this spot since my friend showed it to me. We got it delivered to work as well, which was pretty awesome. So far, everyone I have taken there has enjoyed the food.
author: Humberto F.

description:
It's a hot potato with toppings that you choose.. how can it go wrong?  The people who work here are super nice.  I get the potato without butter since they already load it up with cheese.  The place is clean and well kept.  I work around Pier 39 and its always hard to find a decent place to eat.  This will be my lunch stop staple.

Tip: if you work around there, you get 10% off.
author: Helen C.

description:
Gotta love a place that serves BAKED POTATOES!!!!


I've had the chicken one and The Wharf. Love them both

The Wharf could use a little more crab and lemon.

Would also love it if they had Tapatio hot sauce in addition to the Tabasco they already have. 

A few more drink selections would be nice also. 

All in all, they're AWESOME!
author: Leo V.

description:
Discovered this place from the thrillist and then yelped.

The store: pretty spacious, frozen yogurt shop type of feel to it. You can see them make your potato when you order like at Subway. You eat at tall, shared, bar tables.

Location: I came on a rainy Sunday afternoon so there were plenty of metered parking but since it's located by pier 39, I would imagine it'd be hard to find parking.

Food: I got The Wharf which has crab, onions, corn, green onions, and sour cream. All potatoes come with butter and cheese mixed into it. It was pretty good until the richness got to me. Only finished about 2/3rds of the potato. The potato itself is pretty big. Pricing is on the higher side. $10 for the whole thing. The sweet potato cheesecake on the other hand is to die for. The sweet potato brownie is good but not amazing.

Mention Yelp and you could get a 10% or 15% discount. I forget which one. I'd be down to come back and try more. Next time.. less cheese and more premium toppings please.
author: Dorothy W.

description: The potatoes were to die for however, they have to work on being more organized and a little cleaner.
author: Ally M.

description: First time here, very friendly staff. Everything looked great, chicken spud was awesome!
author: Eric H.

description:
Good food, reasonable prices.  The potatos were GIANT.  The filling tasted really good and seemed fresh.

I was totally surprised that the store was so empty, but I figure it's busier on a weekday lunch thing.  We would have given four stars based on the filling, but both of our potatos were burnt on the outside.

Otherwise, a good deal.
author: Suze C.

description:
I officially love Hot Spud.

1) Ingredients
Every single ingredient is fresh and great quality. From the cheese to the peas!

2) Portions
One potato. One meal. Very satisfying.

3) Options
You can build it however you want and there's a long list to choose from.

4) Service
Everyone is super friendly! And it's quick!

One of the best places to eat at and avoid tourists. 
Also, it's affordable (sweet!)
author: kevin l.

description: This was one of the places I told myself i wanted to try while in San Francisco! I ordered the chicken potato and had no complaints! Very tasty and the hot sauce made it especially yummy! My sister ordered the veggie one, and she needed to add a little hot sauce to hers but all in all the food was good. I wouldn't say it was anything spectacular but then came the desserts! Gluten free cheesecake and gluten free brownies! Amazing! The potatoes were good but the desserts here made this a 4 star for me!
author: Tiffany A.

description:
I really wanted to be excited about this place after seeing the stellar reviews from other Yelpers.  We had an opportunity to eat here after a cruise in the Bay, and walked a bit out of our way to find it.  

Stuff in a potato.  High quality ingredients and friendly service at a decent price.  But on the whole, I think it was AOK.  

The restaurant has a chilly feel to it, despite the name being Hot Spud.  The seating and decor reminds me of a froyo place a la Pinkberry because of the modern minimalist furniture and colored lights.  Maybe that's why I didn't get as much out of the experience as I had expected.  

But maybe I'm just not enough into potatoes.   

Bummed that I forgot to mention Yelp for a discount.  If you're going, make sure you write that down on your hand.
author: Elaine S.

description: Shrimp Hot spud is fantastic. It has a nice kick and the flavor works out really well. They're excellent when you're in the mood for spud. That said, I give Hot Spud only 3/5 because it's not a place where I'd go out of my way to go eat. It's more a if I'm around I'll visit.
author: Daniel K.

description:
3 stars for the tater, plus 1 for a different & decent non-tourist trap in the neighborhood.  Got the chicken & the potato itself was very well-cooked.  The first of the few ingredients going in made it great: butter, salt, cheese.  But the non-native toppings I could probably do without - chicken was kind of tasteless, olives were canned, wing sauce was thin.  It was so tempting to get an entire production of a baked potato.  Think if i'd stuck with the basics, it could have been an ethereal tater. 

Regardless, I'm super happy I found it.  Staff was very friendly, guy manning register (presumably the owner) gave me 10% off & we chatted briefly about this potato bar trend in Europe.  Great concept for a quick lunch spot in any city with a downtown workers hub - they should definitely franchise.
author: Talia R.

description: I had a vegetable spud with chipotle tarter sauce.  It was delicious!   The sauce had the perfect amount of spice to bring out the flavor of the potato without overwhelming it.
author: Sue L.

description: I love potatoes! It reminds me of a chain called 'Kumpir' we have in Hamburg/Germany. It's not as good but still I'm happy to find a potato place like that in San Fran. You get a baked potato mixed with butter & cheese and then you can choose toppings like corn, salad, chicken etc. and a sauce. Very simple, very good, pretty healthy:) It's a good snack.
author: Katja J.

description: Great grilled shrimp chipotle baked potato tonight.  I had an Izze sparkling Pomegranate soda with it.  A warm comfort dinner on a chilly night in sanfran!
author: Powell S.

description: I was hanging out in San Francisco with my best friend, vacationing it up when we decided we needed a filling yet cheap bite to eat. We  wanted something that we couldn't find back home but that would be delicious, so we turned to our handy dandy Yelp app. Oh were we happy, a baked potato bar only a block walk away! We trotted along, and the place was fairly dead. We ordered our potatoes, I got the veggie she got the steak. The staff was great with making sauce recommendation and I was in heaven once my fork reached my mouth! We had just beat the crowd because as we ate the line gathered and we were happy that we didn't let the initial lack of patrons deter us. I really wish we had one in SoCal, I would for sure be a frequent customer!
author: Mallorie A.

description: I go here about once a week.  Since I found out I have celiac disease about a year and a half ago, its one of the few places in SF that has NEVER made me sick.  I love the chicken spud and I always get extra chicken to make it a dinner sized portion.  The sweet potato brownies are awesome!  Very nice owner and friendly staff.  Its fun to get a spud and then go to Musée Mécanique..which is a couple blocks away.  Also nice to call ahead and get them to go for a picnic...
author: Banana G.

description: Hot spud rocks!! Been there a number of times and it has always been delish!! Service is great too!
author: AJ S.

description: Best hot potatoes I've ever eaten! Rich, creamy texture and loaded with cheese and veggies. I'd go here every time I go to Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Shyam B.

description: My gluten free go to spot when visiting the wharf
author: Rew P.

description: DELISH! And if you use a Living Social coupon, you basically only have to pay $3.50 for a baked potato. Ordered the Fisherman's Wharf and the Sausage baked potato. Both were huge and chock-full of goodies. The Fisherman's Wharf was FULL of crab but had a pretty subtle flavor. The sausage baked potato was delicious though! Really filling, really flavorful, and surprisingly, not touristy at all like all the places around it (it's right near Fisherman's wharf)
author: Diana Y.

description: A friend and I chose this place on a whim with some help from Yelp while on our road trip to San Francisco.  Plus it is walking distance from our hotel room.  The interior was clean, organized and welcoming.  I've noticed an enticing stocked shelf of refrigerated refreshments by the side.  Why not?  I helped myself to Steam Anchor beer.  Our potatoes was ready in about 10 minutes.  Hers had shrimp, while I had the Veggie Spud.  Our meal was enjoyable.  We could finish barely our share of sweet potato brownie.  This place is highly recommended for a quick bite or three while not feeling a pinch on the wallet in a tourist trap area.
author: Archie L.

description:
Such a great concept and completely lives up to the great reviews! The Cajun shrimp potato comes with fresh grilled shrimp, Cajun tartar, corn, onions, green onions and sounds rather strange but was absolutely amazing. In total, probably about $11 with soda/tax.

I really can't go on about how much I enjoyed Hot Spud! 

Great find!!!
author: Amy T.

description:
A refreshing addition to the neighborhood. Mention that you're local for 10% off. 

The Thai crunch salad is great
author: M M.

description: Will definitely be returning, a really good, filling lunch place at a cheap price! Plus they are almost entirely gluten free and use some local ingredients.
author: Libby C.

description:
This place is AMAZING.

I randomly discovered it while walking home from work one day and I decided I absolutely had to go in. I've gone twice in the past four days. I am officially addicted. The staff is super friendly and helpful and they have a list of allergens to make sure that no one gets sick from the food. The ingredients are fresh and delicious and they offer student discounts! All in all this is definitely one of my new favorite places in the city!
author: nikole s.

description: LOVE this place!!! It's a gluten free haven- my fav is the chicken spud and the sweet potato cheesecake of course! :-)
author: Lindsay A.

description: It's really about a 4.5 stars but going 5 because the gluten free sweet potato brownies are the best ever... EVER.  That's GF or no GF they are the best.  The baked potatoes are good with lots of gluten free options. The brownies, cheesecake and rice pudding make this place THE BOMB!  A real treat to have high quality gluten free foods, with reasonable prices, and super nice people working there. Keep up the good work!
author: SacTown G.

description: Hey there Hot Spud! This place was across the street from my hotel room and I had to try it. I can't believe these places aren't popping up all over the coutry! So simple, yet so amazing. When you enter you are given your potato and asked to choose your toppings. They also have specialty potatoes that you can order. It is like the Chipotle of potatoes. I loved it, I want to go back, but alas....there is not a location in San Diego...hint hint, wink wink. P.S. try there burnt pudding. Wish they were open later.
author: Amanda H.

description: Friendly owners who are warm and welcoming. They explained the menu to us and gladly accepted our KGB Deal I purchased without any fuss. These stuffed potatoes are huge and yummy. The skin comes salted and there is a nice amount of topping to fully enjoy it. I'm happy we made the trip over the bridge for these. They are located in a touristy area but hey its fun to be a tourist every once in a while.
author: Trish B.

description:
let's be honest.  this place gets 3 stars for the name alone.  

the food wasn't bad either.  i got a tater with broccoli, corn and onions.  the potato itself was really good.  some of the best skin on a potato i've had in a while.  the fillings were fine, but nothing special.  i wish there had been more broccoli.  double broccoli next time?
author: Rachel H.

description: What a gem!!!  I do business around there and sometimes I have to work late and don't feel like being hosed by Fisherman's Warf prices.  This place was amazing.  You can get one of their signature potatoes or build your own.  I built my own and got to choose everything I wanted on my spud.  At the end I had a delicious baked potato but under $5!!!  Yeah, they give you a neighborhood discount if you're a local!  Awesome place can't say enough about it!
author: Kirsten M.

description: I was never a fan of baked potatoes up until now.  Steak on a potato? YES PLEASE!  Very filling and delicious.  I ordered steak with extra steak and added crab and EXTRA crab.  but sadly, it came out to be a 20$ baked potato with very scarce Crab meat,  I felt pretty ripped off, but I still enjoyed the potato.  I will definitively come back if I'm the Fisherman's wharf area.  But now I know, stick to the steak never add the crab meat, worse 7 bucks wasted :(  Do try it!
author: Ray S.

description: Great spuds, but I only order from them about half as often as I want to.  Turns out drunk and tired me wants hot spuds... generally around 9:20pm, and they close at 9pm on weekends, and 8 during the week.  So, definitely not a late night place.  But super tasty!!  Really wish they were open until 10/10:30 on Friday/Saturday nights.
author: Jaq S.

description: I like the place, and the staff, and the idea, and the food.. but sometimes, it takes 15 minutes to make one potato, and usually, they're out of something I'd like. I'm pretty hesitant to return, but I probably will.
author: Michelle S.

description: Delicious Sausage Spuds. They do ALL the hard work. It's brilliant, simple and improved since last I visited. Never being one to waste food I really like how they dig out and loosen ever last bit of potato. The toppings are simple and fresh. I do have a love affair with the potato so I'm glad this place is a long walk from my house or it would be a lunch time regular. Creative niche on a simple item, friendly staff, well done at the price point.
author: Nelson C.

description: I just ate here for the first time.  I had the veggie spud and added chicken.  I used the lemon butter sauce, and it was really good.  Hit the spot.  The people behind the counter were super friendly and the place is really clean.  The salads look amazing too.  I'll be back in this week to try one of the salads.  Even though it's in tourist haven, I'm a local and I enjoyed it.
author: Amber M.

description: I go to school a couple of blocks from this place and I have regularly eaten lunch here for over a year. The people get to know you by name and pretty much remember every time what you like to order. Their portions are generous, the food is very good and the prices are fair. I love going here and have never heard anyone say that they did not like the food here. Go here and you will for sure love it!
author: Matthew P.

description: My BFF and I both have celiac disease and were in the city for the day and didn't pack a lunch. We were wondering where the heck we could eat gluten free. We found Hot Spud and LOVED it! The owner was there and he explained everything to us and was SUPER nice! We will DEFINATELY eat here again!
author: Natalie S.

description: Best spud I ever had, place could have been a little cleaner. Staff were good but could have been friendlier. They let my friends son eat his subway sandwich there as he did not want a spud. Good value, especially for the area.
author: Trevor W.

description:
A baked potato spot....

Tastes Good: Yes

Fills you up: Yes

Healthy: Yes

Price: Cheap

Service: Friendly and Quick 

What more do you want from a place to grab lunch? 

5 Stars. Fast.
author: Cam K.

description: Nice idea. Good food. Baked potato stuffed with your choice of veggies and meats and condiments. Location is great too, right next to Fisherman's Wharf.
author: VA N.

description: I have no clue how this place has the amount of stars it does. The idea is great. The execution and poor quality ingredients are not. I got the Warf which sounded great crab on a potato I sampled the sauce, it was good. The baked potato was hot. Why then would you pour cold canned corn all over it with cold crab (that may or may not be canned) I will never know. If everything was hot then it might of tasted better. On top of that they used  almost a whole can. BUNK. My boyfriend got the steak potato. Everything hot except the canned corn and canned peas WTF are you kidding me. hot mushrooms hot steak cold peas and corn. I don't get it. The steak was so chewy. This place could be so much better. Ok so the food BLOWS. And I was going to give this maybe 3 stars and I really tried to like it but then all the workers were talking about drugs, loud, rude, in public.....its like cool dude you smoke pot bruh. yeah. Don't really care. Quit swearing. The decor looks like a baked potato without any toppings bland. Im actually pretty mad I wasted $26.00 here and even the brownie sucked and its a brownie. This place was empty so I say some of these reviews were faked....cold canned corn on a hot baked potato with cooked steak....NO just no. You can make a better baked potato in your kitchen for less money!
author: Nykky D.

description: I have a baked potato addiction, so when I saw a coupon for this place on KGBDeals, I figured I had nothing to lose. I am so glad I went for it. I visited with three other people, including my mom who is not a fan of baked potatoes. We got The Wharf, the Chicken Spud, the Steak Spud, Clam Chowder, the Burnt Rice Pudding, and the Sweet Potato Cheesecake. I was a little skeptical about some of the toppings and sauces (alfredo sauce on a potato?), but somehow the combination work. Everybody, including my mom, thought everything was AWESOME! If they had a location in the East Bay, I would visit regularly.
author: Melinda S.

description: Just a quick "thumb's up" for Hot Spud -- it's fast, fresh, and yummy. I don't see enough people in there (because it's off the beaten path), which is a shame. The staff are friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. I only hope they open more locations in the Bay Area!
author: carnaby s.

description: What a great respite from the touristy stuff at Fisherman's wharf! The portions are generous, the ingredients delicious and this sums up to a fantastic jacket potato. My wife, a potato lover, still raves about our meal here and going back.
author: Tyler H.

description: I wouldn't have thought 5 stars either. But it truly is great. I don't know if I am being influenced by the lack of any good food around FW, or because it was a rainy cold sad day. I have walked by many times and have never been convinced of the concept and it also took over the space that had the best breakfast burritos down here, so maybe I was a little bitter. So I trusted yelp on this one and it didn't disappoint. I had the shrimp potato with tasty sauce butter cheese and green onion. Sauce great, shrimp and potato cooked perfect. It was fantastic and satisfying the only way a lump of potato in your stomach could be. The owner and staff are super friendly and were really attentive and helpful to the customers. It's also a nice little place to be in. FW winner. Well done Hot Spud. Nap time.
author: William R.

description: Pretty tasty lunch spot and not at all touristy - I had the chicken spud - I'd suggest adding some cilantro to it.  Tasty...
author: Erin Q.

description:
Have you ever said to yourself "Man, someone needs to bring back the baked potato bar" Well, Hot Spud has done just that as well as offering premium baked potato options like the Wharf Spud, that uses real crab meat. They even build your spuds the right way, buy melting in the butter and cheese while they fluff the spud. 

If you're a tourist visiting Fisherman's Wharf, it's worth getting off the beaten path for some good quality, non-commercial, healthy food. And, if stuffed spuds aren't your thing... then try their Crispy Thai Salad!

A while ago I would have given this place a lower rating because one of the workers prepped my spud until it was cold then he added in the rest of the chilled ingredients, but instead i mentioned my concern to another employee, who turned out to be the owner. 

Ever since that day, every
 time I go in he makes special efforts to ensure that my baked potato concoction is hot and to my liking.

They even have a chart on display for people with food allergies. Granted, if you have a food allergy you should educate your self and know what to stay away from... But the people at Hot Spud have made it a priority to list out their ingredients on the chart to guide the customer with their choices. To me that just shows that they care for and know their customers.

Now, my only complaint is they need more locations in the city. :D
author: J R.

description: Eat here....nothing beats a hot spud in cold sf......grab it and hit the waterfront for a dining delight.....
author: Brian E.

description: My new lunch hour haunt. So Good. I love the Fruit and Nut Salad and the Chicken Spud with Wing Sauce. Today I had the custom spud and added steak and vegetables. All of my co workers went there today and came back stuffed. Its an upscale, hip, better-than Subway. You can pick the items to top your potato and all the guys that work there are attractive.....Studs Serving Spuds. Nice.
author: Aimee G.

description: Love the concept and wish Sacramento had one. I created my own potato and it was beyond delicious. Everything was fresh and it was full of flavor. Being that I have to adhere to a gluten free diet it was so nice to not have to worry about cross contamination because everything but two menu item are gluten free. Don't walk, run to hot spud if your in the area. I can't wait to go back the next time I am in SF.
author: Julie C.

description:
Holy crap, I'm so full!! After being tipped off by a colleague, I decided to check out Hot Spud for lunch. I was not disappointed, as I often am when going out for lunch in the area. 

Now, if you have the misfortune of working in the Fisherman's Wharf area, you know how challenging it is to find a decent lunch place. For the past six years (yes, I've worked in the area for six years) I've pretty much relegated myself to three places, only one of which I actually like. So I'm thrilled Hot Spud is around the corner. 

I went over with low expectations. However, I was extremely impressed by how spacious, clean and tastefully decorated this place is. I was actually expecting a crappy, cramped fast food-type stand. Also, all of the potato toppings are visible, so you can easily personalize your own potato. Always one to be overwhelmed by too many yummy choices, I opted for one of their specialized potatoes--the grilled shrimp. The workers were extremely friendly and enthusiastic, and politely asked if I was okay with waiting 5 to 7 minutes because they grill the shrimp to order. Hell yes!! 

Because I didn't think a potato would be enough for lunch, I also ordered a sweet potato brownie. Well, it was more than enough for lunch. Two hours later and I'm still stuffed. And not only was it filling, everything was perfectly cooked and delicious. I can't comment on the brownie yet, because I'm still too full to indulge in dessert. 

Bonus points for discounts for people who work in the area!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I work near the Wharf and have really been looking forward to the opening of Hot Spud. I guess so have a lot of other people- they ran out of potatoes the first time I tried to eat there. 

I probably don't need to tell you that  there isn't much at the Wharf in the way of healthy and affordable food so this fills a huge gap.

The food: I got a bulid your own potato and added grilled chicken. Everything was fresh and well prepared, the chicken was tender and moist. The potato is not as big as you'd expect for the prices. Mine had a big black spot, not really their fault but a bummer. You can choose up to 4 vegetables to add in BUT they are not listed on the menu board so that would be helpful.  I guess they don't come with sour cream? or maybe I didn't see it, or they didn't ask -- seems like an obvious one to me. They didn't ask if I wanted a sauce. The stuffed potatoes have a lot of hidden fat -- a huge scoop of butter, cheese, the sauces are all mayo based. So calorie wise don't be fooled. I think they need to come up with a skinny potato, and offer reduced fat sour crean, low-fat sauce, maybe some salsas or something else to add flavor but reduce fat content.

Most people who work in the area grab a salad at Trader Joe or a sandwhich at Safeway. Picewise, a potato with fixin's and grilled chicken will run you about $8.50 so Hot Spud is a little north of my daily lunch budget. The owner did mention they will launch a discount program for people in the neighborhood and I was very pleased by that! I think they will do well!
author: Des R.

description:
I've been known to pose some pretty monumental thought-provoking questions in my time, and one of my favorites to ask is "if you could only eat one starch, which would it be?" Obviously, with 5 stars you know my preference. Even if you're not a potato head, there are so many great things about these potatoes that might make you switch. When you order you can watch them mix the butter and cheese with such fervor that the insides convert to a sort of mashed potato mixture. Top that creamy potato filling with grilled meats, vibrant sauces, fresh veggies, and you have one amazing baked potato.
The place is clean with a great design. The principals are all on site, ensuring that your experience is good enough for a return visit. If I lived closer I'm afraid I would be there all the time. Also received a sampling of their sweet potato desserts--pie and brownie--and both were amazing. Had the signature chicken with spicy wing sauce and the signature shrimp with buerre blanc. Can't decide which was better.
author: sunny m.

description: excellent food. i ordered steak spud and loved it. staff are very friendly.
author: Jo A.

description:
I typed "gluten-free" and "San Francisco" into the yelp search bar and this came up. I was going to a comedy show in the area so I thought why not. the pictures on yelp looked good and the reviews were alright. When our group of 4 got there, we waited 10 minutes for the person behind the counter to finish the 2 potatoes they were working on for the people ahead of us. When we ordered, the food took about 15 minutes to make and the cashier took 10 minutes to slice a piece of cheesecake and ring up our order (for 2). This all appeared to be because they were understaffed or just new to being in business. I'll cut them slack for that. When the food came it was underwhelming. We ordered the wharf stud with crab and there was barely any crab, probably only one of the ounce measuring cups worth. Most of the stud was corn and there was almost no cheese what-so-ever. We ate our food and didn't make a fuss because more people came in and the staff struggled again with more than 1 order AND we needed to go to our show. All in all the food tasted like the baked potatoes we get at Mills College in the cafeteria, not worth $11. But maybe when they have more staff and get their act together they are better. 

Even though our potatoes were so-so the sweet potato cheesecake was FABULOUS!
author: Brittany W.

description:
Who knew a potato could be so good?  I was in the store recently and got the veggie potato.  The potato was very fresh and amazingly well cooked (mom never made them so good).  The veggies were fresh, the peas were actually crisp, I could tell they were straight from the garden and not frozen.  I picked a chipotle sauce, which was just the right amount of flavor and heat (next time, extra chipotle, please).  Surprisingly I was full from one potato, it made a very good lunch.

The sweet potato pie (which they generously offered to have me try gratis) was absolutely delicious, a 10.  They could build a business around sweet potato pies if they wanted.

There aren't many reasons for locals to head to Fisherman's Wharf, but Hot Spud is one (or the only) excuse to go.
author: Justin M.

description:
What a great find near the wharf!  I only had a vague idea what to expect from a specialty hot potato restaurant, and I really wasn't sure that it would be a full meal, but the line seemed to indicate that it would be a good lunch spot.  
I was definitely wrong about the meal size.  I was barely able to finish my Chicken spud, which had a really nice blend of ingredients and flavors.  These are not simple, plane-jane baked potatoes.  The chef obviously took some time to craft the ingredient list for the signature spuds and my lunch mates all found something appealing on the menu.  
All of the vegetables were fresh and crisp.  The chicken was tender and complimented with the perfect amount of buffalo sauce.  I was definitely in heaven.  
One of the owners offered us free samples of their desserts (brownie and sweet potato pie), both of which were great homemade treats.  Unfortunately, I was too full to order a whole piece.  
I really enjoyed the energy that the owners put into making everyone feel welcome and cared for, which is so often missing in the casual lunch scene.  
I can't wait to go back!  (Crab spud is next on the agenda)
author: christopher w.

description: Great idea, great food. The salad and potato (bacon, veggies and blue cheese) were filling and delicious. Good drink selection, nice clean facilities.
author: Joe G.

description: This place is DELICIOUS!! Great Spuds, great salads, GREAT service! Loved the creamy cilantro dressing and the selection of beverages (especially the Virgil's Root Beer :) can't wait to come back!
author: Nickole S.

description: Wow, this is great. Real friendly. I saw people not eat their potato part (skin). You have to eat the potato part, it is awesome.
author: Christopher R.

description: We noticed this place on our way to Subway which is located in the same street. After seeing the menu we thought we will give it a try. We were glad about our decision to eat there. Food was delicious and the idea of having it on top of baked potato was awesome. We tried the veggie spud and it was worthy. I will go again and try the Chicken spud next time.
author: Chandru S.

description: Visited SF this weekend and ended up eating at the Spud twice it was so good. Tried both the chicken and the steak spuds and still cant decide which I enjoyed more. The potato was cooked and seasoned to perfection, the meat was tender, and the toppings were fresh and great quality. I wish we had one in SoCal..I think it's going to be the next up and coming hot chain!!
author: Marian G.

description: I love this place. You don't have to get a spud with everything on it to enjoy one, though I always do. The spuds are SO CREATIVE and not to forget, DELICIOUS. Whether you work around the corner or are a tourist, it's a definite stop for a bite to eat. Also have to mention that the service is really good. Spud really cares about their customers.
author: David L.

description: When you walk in, everything is set up like a Subway.  All the ingredients are fresh, and displayed nicely along the line.  Everyone is extremely helpful and nice.  The toppings are generous, and overall this was an extremely good meal.
author: David S.

description: I needed something "eating clean" style while I stayed at the Sheraton. I love Hot Spud. The people are great, the veggie soup is dairy free and contains quinoa! Just like home, only better because they make it, and offer me delicious potatoes. I got a plain baked on with butter (not very much so don't worry) and green peas. My favorite place on FW.
author: Never M.

description: They make the best baked potato concoctions! Friendly service and very clean! Gotta check them out.
author: Caryn S.

description: This is a great concept on a baked potato.  I like the different sauces and add-ins. There are a variety of combinations to choose from and a choice to build your on as well. It is the same for the salads. Nice choice of drinks too.
author: Wanda K.

description: The food was good but the menu selection is small. Better than any other fast food place we saw along fisherman's wharf.
author: L S.

description: Worth the drive! We had two loaded baked potatoes, and one salad,at about $25. (i think one drink too) Delicious! Every bite of everything was amazing. We told the manager we had found it on yelp and he gave us a $2 discount. Really good service. I will return on my next trip to SF.
author: shona m.

description: Skip the salads and go for the potato. The Chicken Spud (aka Chicken Bomb) is insane. I'd be scared to see the calorie counts on the potato selections.
author: Scott M.

description: I had such a nice and cheap spud. I can imagine eating every day there!
author: Seb S.

description: Love this place and wish there was one near me.  Affordable, fresh, healthy, and so tasty.  The staff is friendly ("Feel free to customize the toppings...") and the ambiance is comfortable, casual and modern (and clean!).
author: Kyla M.

description: We are locals and were looking for a place to eat near the wharf and saw Hot Spud.  We walked up and I saw that they do gluten free (on the window) and I have an intolerance so I liked that right away.  We went in and immediately liked the concept of a quick and easy meal that didn't have to be full of fat.  The staff were patient while we went throught the menu and asked questions.  My baked potato had prawns, corn, onions and olives and it was totally yummy.  When we got up to leave, I told the staff how much we liked it and they were all sooooooo friendy.  Cheers to Hot Spud, Prince and Will and the nice young lady whose name I forgot.  IWe will absolutely eat here again.
author: Laura A.

description: We stayed in a hotel across the street, and had heard good things about this place.  Everything we heard was true.  I had a shrimp spud, and my husband had a sausage spud.  They were both excellent.  In fact, we wish we were staying longer, because we would liked to have tried more.  The man at the counter was really helpful, and very friendly.  We noticed that local workers came here to eat, which is always a good sign.  The spuds are huge and sooo good, right down to the skin!  This is easily an entire meal and not a snack.  Everything was fresh and very tasty!  We really enjoyed our meal, here.
author: Doug Vi S.

description: A friend and I played tourists yesterday in the city and ended up in the Fisherman's Wharf area. We decided to check out Hot Spud and it was DEEE-licious!  I am a buffalo chicken fanatic so I couldn't resist ordering the Chicken spud and I loved every bite. My friend had the Shrimp spud and loved it too. We topped off lunch with a San Francisco Anchor Steam beer and were completely satisfied. We were full but couldn't resist ordering one of the gluten-free sweet potato brownies so we took it to snack on later as we walked through the city. It was cooked to perfection and so moist and fudgy it melted in our mouths. We are so happy that we stopped at the Hot Spud and will definitely be going back next time we hit the city again!
author: Heather B.

description: Great fresh food.  Excellent service, and a fair price point.  If you want a quick, fresh, alternative to the fried Wharf food, consider Hot Spud.
author: Marq T.

description:
Okay we were looking for a place that offered baked potatoes and we were not having any luck... a quick Google search later and we found Hot Spud in the City.

It was awesome!  Nice place, clean, nice vibe and even though it was right around the corner from the Fisherman's Wharf and its myriad of tourist traps, this was a nice comfy place to get some good eats. The folks behind the counter were nice, very friendly and helpful.

I went more traditional with the grilled chicken, bacon, green onions, black olives, corn and cheese... no sour cream for this guy!  I did not go with any of the sauces they offer as I'm just that way.  It was good.  My partner went with the veggie; broccoli, peas, corn, green onions, black olives  and mushrooms... and he went for the full-on sour cream.  

We were both very satisfied and happy to have found this place.  I know we can make these on our own, but it's nice to know when you're out and about you can stop by and get a spud!

They also have great salads and a daily soup... and it's gluten-free!
We will definitely add it to our places to visit when in the city... now if they would open a store in Oakland!
author: Rowdy T.

description: This place was awesome!! Not only were the potatoes delicious, they have GLUTEN FREE sweet potato cheesecake and brownies. And all the sauces were gluten free too. Very allergy-friendly. Will definitely be coming here again!
author: Kimberly d.

description: Hot Spud is awesome.  I have always loved potatoes and never understood why they are relegated to a side dish.  Well not anymore because at hot spud the tater takes center stage.  All the ingredients are really fresh and they don't skimp on the portions, it is as loaded as a baked potato can get.  There are a variety of different sauces that make the potato delicious, my favorite is the chipotle tarter sauce.  All the employees are very friendly and happy to answer any questions you might have.  It is one of the only places on the wharf that I will eat at.
author: Kevin M.

description: Not expensive, quick,good food and friendly service. The Baked potatoes are great - options for vegetarians too, and kid friendly to boot!
author: B D.

description: Great food, friendly service, who could ask for more?  We stumbled across this joint on a walk down to the wharf.  One of our party has a gluten allergy and we stopped in to see if she could be accommodated.  The staff was glad to help and knew exactly what she could and couldn't have.  The potatoes were delicious and I was pleased with how well the potato was mixed up so that you got toppings in every bite.  If I lived in SF, I'd be a regular customer.
author: Josh G.

description: I was there in February and I'm still thinking about this place.  Can't wait to go back.  Crab potato and chipotle tomato soup were fantastic. You can walk by every restaurant on Fisherman's Wharf and head straight into Hot Spud. The service was friendly and I enjoyed a great lunch.
author: D'jango J.

description: What a great find! The potatoes are excellent, the staff is friendly and helpful! I have an allergy an employee went out of her way to help me out! Great service and food! Try the sweet potato cheesecake and sweet potato brownies!
author: Angela A.

description: Best spud I've ever had! The people were super friendly and even honored the yelp 10% discount. Only thing to use the bathroom you need a key.
author: Family M.

description: I pretty much never wrote a review yet on yelp, but after coming to this joint I sworn I would write one so here it is.  First off, I LOVE potatoes.. any shape or form if it were Mashed, french fries, or baked!  We were heading to Pier 39 and on the way a friend spotted the place and said I seen this place before and I've always wanted to go! So we all agreed, why don't we just go in now for a snack since we were hungry.  I ordered the Steak Spud...$8.95 grilled steak, alfredo sauce, sautéed mushrooms, black olives, peas, corn, green onion.. So to begin the potato is freshly baked and hot and one by one they start loading in all the sides mixing and stiring it all up together.. at first bite I fell in love and that's all I got to say about that. Just on a side note their cheese cake is delicious!   I won't be able to go there for a while because I'm getting deployed but I know where I'm going to eat as soon as I get back to the Bay.   Hot Spud!!
author: Glenn S.

description: I like this place a lot.  The interior is nice, and the owners are very friendly.  The potato tasted fresh, and lots of options for sauces.  I'm happy to have this place in the neighborhood.
author: Tim R.

description:
I just had what is sure to be the first of many hot spuds. I came seeking a little variety from standard lunch fair but not expecting much else. What I found simply knocked my socks off. Yes it is "just a stuffed patato".. but it's a stuffed potatoe the way a chef does a stuffed potatoe. The potatoe was light and fluffy and the toppings were fresh and of the highest quality. The chef has clearly considered what flavors work well together here. 
I got the chicken spud because I'm a sucker for buffalo sauce and was pleasantly surprised that the sauce was just one of many subtle flavors in the dish. The crisp fresh corn stood out nicely against the softer texture of the potatoe and the black olives added just enough bite.  I'm surprised I'm tryng to describe the complexity of a baked potatoe, but I was so pleased by the meal that I want everyone who reads this to get that this is not your wendy's baked potatoe but something so much more.
Give it a try. And don't miss out on desert. The sweet potatoe pie is as good as you've ever had anywhere.
author: Brian M.

description: This place is great!  I live in the neighborhood and happened upon it one day.  The potatoes are great and one is definitely enough for a whole meal.  Even more, this place has the friendliest and most helpful staff I have ever seen at a restaurant.  HIGHLY recommend this place.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Wow! Talk about a tasty explosion in your mouth. I love hot spud! First, the service there was awesome. People were ready to help with smiles on their face, to ensure that my experience was a good one. I got the chicken spud... It was delicious. The buffalo sauce on it makes it tangy and pop in your mouth. I also got to try a bite of the shrimp spud... And that one melts in your mouth. I'm definitely getting the shrimp spud next time. Salad was crisp, fresh, and perfect. Lastly, to top it all off... You have to try the sweet potato brownies... A nice sweet end to a great lunch!
author: melissa k.

description: My daughter has to eat gluten free and Hot Spud has many options.  The owners know about wheat issues and have a lot to offer.  My daughter loved her "spud", she said it was the best ever!
author: Helenmarie S.

description: The baked potato was delicious and the staff was super friendly.  Their menu was also very clear about potential food allergies, which I really appreciated.  Great place to stop on your way around the city!
author: Sharon P.

description: Wow I loved the creat your own spud!! It's soo tasty and the staff is very friendly!!!
author: Olivia S.

description: This is an excellent fast food place a half block from the bustle of Pier 39. The concept is you get a baked potato with butter, cheese and salt and then add whatever toppings you want plus a sauce if you so desire. All the toppings are fresh and yummy and they give you plenty of everything. Almost everything is naturally gluten free plus they have gluten free desserts. A great find and a nice break from all the pricier joints in the area.
author: Miles U.

description: i was looking for a gluten free place to go and this was the place! Really good you can customize your huge baked potato with almost anything you could think. The staff was very helpful and the price was right.
author: Kim r.

description: While it is easy to think that you would have a lot of food options while living a block around the wharf, it is not really so. there is only so much pizza/italian or seafood one can have. The only other cuisine that I find at a walkable distance is a less than ok Thai place and a great Argentinean food truck. Happened to walk past HotSpud a few times. Tried the chicken one it for lunch today...actually took it to go. It was so delicious! Different flavors and textures just burst in my mouth. A little pricey in my opinion but great taste! Also get 10% off for locals. I'm going back for more :-)
author: MrsNIFTY G.

description: I LOVE HOT SPUD! amazing quality amazing service amazing food! whenever i am hungry and want to eat out i always go there.  the owners are super friendly and always smiling.  the dessert is also amazing too! ill never eat a baked potato anywhere else honestly
author: Soupy M.

description: I was really forward to eating a baked potato at Hot Spud after seeing the 4.5 stars rating it has.  I don't regret trying the place because if I didn't then I wouldn't be able to yelp it.  My friends and I were all about to eat here, but they said they only had 6 potatoes left, and the next batch would come out in 20 minutes.  Most of my friends decided to eat at Fisherman's Wharf instead.  I ordered the shrimp spud.  My baked potato was loaded with olives, green onions, corn, cheese, chipotle sauce, and 5 pieces of grilled shrimp.  The first bite tasted pretty good with everything layered.  However, the rest of the potato became less enjoyable because the proportion of grilled shrimp didn't balance with the proportion of the potato.  At the end, everything just because a mixture of chipotle mush.  My friend ordered The Wharf Spud, which was loaded with red onions, green onions, and crab meat.  The crab complimented the potato pretty well because all the flavors were very settled.  I think it would have tasted better without the raw onions.
author: Cindy H.
